Don't expect any kind of miracle from this stuff - my KP has not gone away, but it has become noticeable less bumpy. I still have little red dots on my upper arms, but they're not bumps, so that's a definite improvement in my book!
summary: KP is definitely slightly better, but not completely gone by any means

reviewText: This looks amazing in sunlight -- it's not quite a neon but it's definitely bright and noticeable. I love this color because I've been looking for a bright bubblegum pink, and this is perfect! The formula is typical Essie - kinda gloopy and thick - but not too bad.
goes on non greasy. Does not have a heavy smell to it. Makes my skin feel very soft and supple. Definitely something I would continue to use.  Like it a lot
amazing acne system for mild to moderate non cystic adult female acne
It does good.
Great brand but wrong product for me. I exchanged for another Lorac foundation.
summary: Good product but drying for me

reviewText:
I'm not sure how La Roche can claim this product reduces the dark circles.  I thought the metal applicator was the revolutionary process plus maybe the caffeine.  Not so.  It may be used as a concealer and, as such, it's not light enough for me.  I tried it several times, morning and night and found no difference.  I added a concealer on top of this product and it seemed to work better but, honestly, I couldn't tell if it was the combination of the two with the added enhancement of another texture.

The pigmenatclar has a smooth texture and the actual case is sturdy and of high quality.  Unfortunately, it was not the miracle to erase years of genetics, age or irregular skin tones
awesome
Pricey but easy to apply.  Goes on well and lasts.  VERY glossy.
This is such a beautiful color. Goes on easily. The downside is that it chips quite easily. Maybe I put on my coats too thickly but they did chip after day 3.
My favorite spring and summer coral!

Per the wife: I bought this at Nordstrom (same price). I don't like the applicator (the brush is not easy to use and it is more difficult to control how much product comes out - I am pretty sure that I am using it at twice the rate of the regular gel, and it is three times the price). This gel dries out substantially faster than the regular gel in my opinion, making it more difficult to use. I have not noticed any difference in terms of this 24k gold firming gel, and at this price, I am not buying it again. Stick with the regular gel, which is less expensive and does the job.
summary: Stick with the regular gel - does the job for 1/3 of the price.

reviewText: I love this serum! This is the third Vichy product that I have tried and it is my absolute favorite. This serum goes on nice and light and adds much needed moisturizer. It has no scent - at least that I could smell. It left my skin feeling soft and smooth with no burn at all.

This review is for the "Scallywag" shade, a lovely blue/teal glitter polish.  I think it's great.  I put it on my toes and it still looked perfect several days later.  It was very easy to apply, despite the glitter (which can sometimes make polish less smooth -- but not in this case!).

It did take three coats to become opaque, instead of the usual two.  However, since it's mostly glitter without a base color, that's not too bad.  I used a Seche Vite quick-dry topcoat (no base coat) and it helped this polish to dry quickly.

I thought the brush was nice.  I kind of don't like the rectangular "extra" black cap on top of the applicator, though.  It seems like a waste of plastic and it was a little difficult for me to remove, for some reason.  However, overall, this is a good polish -- even if it's been sitting around for close to a year (just shake it up a bit) and I think I will get many uses out of it.  Free of lots of different toxic ingredients, as well.

Update: Two weeks later, some of the glitter had rubbed off my smallest toes.  However, that's still pretty long wear.  Also, this was one of the easier glitter polishes I've tried when it comes to removal.

When I grew up it seemed that Old Spice was the only men's fragrance around and, frankly, I just hated it.  Then along came Christian Dior's Eau Sauvage with (what I thought then) well balanced fruit and spice scents.  Here we are 50 years later (in fact Eau Sauvage was introduced exactly 50 years ago) and I just may change the scent I use when good old male sweat is not quite appropriate (which is just about any time I am not wearing jeans and even sometimes when I am in jeans).  I love the woody smells combined with fruits like dates and herbs like cilantro and then the addition of leather - it's the leather that really hits me and is definitely something that is missing from the original formulation of my old standby Eau Sauvage.
summary: Time to change my go to scent

reviewText: This mouse is a little dry for my skin, so I had to add a few drops of cocoa butter to the mixture. Then it went on very smooth. Looks nice and natural. I like that it has no odor, and once applied doesn't crease into the folds of your wrinkles. It seems to plump them.
summary: With a few drops of shea or cocoa butter, it works fine

reviewText:
I have a couple of broken vessels near my nose that are more annoying than anything. I usually cover them with foundation. I've tried this gel as directed and I have seen a moderate reduction in the redness over time. The gel feels like it would be tacky on the face but I have not found this to be the case. It dries smoothly.

For my purposes, I need very little gel so this small container will last me quite a while. If you were trying to cover a large area this might get pricey. I wasn't expecting to see any results so I am pleased with the outcome.
summary: Helped a noticeable amount with old broken capillaries.

reviewText: The bottle is attractively wrapped in Burberry cloth. However, the scent is much too strong for my taste. I bit too much spice. A small spray was even too strong to appreciate. I got a second opinion from my hubby & he also felt the scent was too overwhelming.

This applies to all Zoya Nail Polishes.
I purchased Zoya Nail Polish after perusing their large color selection. Their colors really are great - beautiful pigmentation, wide variety of colors, unique colors, etc.
The application isn't as impressive. The brush doesn't fan out like my favorite nail polishes. It goes on very thick. If you put it next to other brands of nail polish (e.g., Essie, Butter London), you can see the difference - Zoya tends to look a bit more sloppy.
Is it worth it? I'm torn. I really do love the unique colors, but I wouldn't stock up on a ton of Zoya colors. I'll pick a few of my favorites and deal with the coverage.
[I will update this review if I notice anything regarding the wear and tear of the nail polish.]
summary: Zoya Nail Polish: Great Color, Not-so-great Coverage

reviewText: everything ok
Love this color and this brand. Wish it was in a lippy form. Arrived very fast from seller and very pleased with Butter London nail products.

GREAT for people like me who suffer from Rosacea, it certainly helps calm your face down, along with making it very soft!! Great Product, packaged very well, shipped right on time!!!! Definitely a returning customer!!
summary: GREAT for people like me who suffer from Rosacea

reviewText: Product is great, received it on time. The color is gorgeous, but since it's so light I needed three coats to make sure it was opaque. The pictures are of my nails in the light and the other is inside.

I have very ruddy cheeks, but most corrective creams either have a mask-like feel or do not neutralize the redness.
This is a CC that feels soft and toned down the ruddiness so much I could actually wear blush. If you have ruddy skin or rosacea you know how you have to forego blush. How many times have you done your makeup including blush and after a few hours you have splotches everywhere.
With this you can but a blush where it looks best, and hours later you still look good.
Not quite as bright aqua as expected and shown but still a great color!
summary: ... bright aqua as expected and shown but still a great color!

style: {'Color:': ' 40W Medium: For medium skin with warm undertones'}
reviewText:
Aside from being completely and totally the wrong color for me (because judging color online is hard), this was an okay product.

I tried covering a scar on my arm.

While I did like the initial job it did covering the scar, I found the product a bit greasy.  I was always aware of feeling it.  Using a setting powder makes it better.

In addition, if you use it without a setting powder, this can rub off and you'll find yourself reapplying.

So simply keep in mind - if you're going to buy this product, you really need to buy a setting powder as well.
If you want a lip liner that is not too defining this is it.  It is subtle in color, but just enough to prevent feathering.
summary: If you want a lip liner that is not too ...

reviewText: Ever since buying this "Perfume" years ago I have had to have it daily! I'll tell you why.  Since I have been using this fragrance I have had nothing but fantastic comments from both ladies and men!  No matter where I'm at - grocery store - furniture store - working at a golf Country Club etc. both men and women always comment how WONDERFUL I smell and then they have to know what it is that I'm wearing. Men that have asked me have actually written i t down so they could buy it for their wives! And women who ask want to buy it immediately too! I am not exaggerating. The other day I went into a Office furniture store to make a purchase. I was talking with the man who was taking my info. about a chair I was ordering and there was a lady who worked there sitting in the back of the room.  I no sooner walk in the store and the lady says to me: "YOU SMELL SO GOOD!!!  WHAT PERFUME ARE YOU WEARING?" I told her Red Door and she said " I had that perfume before but it smells  so GOOD on YOU! I am going to have to buy it again!!! Every single day that I am out and wear this perfume I get the same type of comments...ALWAYS!!  And the way I look at it - as long as I get so many wonderful comments about it - there is no reason to buy or wear anything else! So this is my perfume of choice! Ladies - you MUST BUY IT! And MEN - if you want to buy a perfume for your ladies in your life - you CAN'T GO WRONG WITH RED DOOR! But it has to be the PERFUME - not the eau de toilette!!  It's the eau de toilette that probably doesn't last as long because it's not as strong as the eau de parfume!  You just can't go wrong with this perfume. Even my mother had to go out and buy it years ago after smelling it on me! I've been wearing it since my 30's and now in my 50's. It's perfect for every age as far as I'm concerned.
summary: Red Door Perfume - a MUST HAVE for all ages!!

reviewText: Like many buyers of this brand I discovered this soap while staying at the Four Seasons hotels in Westlake village,ca. These bars smell so good and they last for nearly two months.  Thats just a 2oz bath size ,I can only imagine what the 8oz will stay useful? I have used these soaps for showers due to my water softner and the risk of slipping. Never drying nor any setbacks like itching,sticky film or lots of soap scum. Luxury all wrapped up in one bar

I love the La Roche-Posay brand of products, but this one left my skin too dry in the winter months. My skin is naturally oily, but less so in the winter, so I put this aside to revisit when the weather got warmer. I've already begun gushing oil (it's only April, sigh), so I thought I'd try again. Bingo! This works great in removing my makeup, without stripping my skin.

This product is a foam that comes in a pump bottle. It's not to be used in the eye area. You probably can, but my eyes are extremely sensitive, so I use another product for that purpose.

Recommended!

I normally use a moisturizer with sunscreen under my makeup during the day, so this was adding another layer of makeup that I wasn't sure I needed. After a few weeks of use, I found I liked the effect. If it had sunscreen in it I would have skipped my regular moisturizer altogether.

I was also happy to find that it has all natural ingredients and is silicone free. It didn't make my makeup last any longer, but it did give a nice glow to my skin, which is normally quite dry. On the down side, it didn't minimize the small lines under my eyes on my over age 50 skin. I like it enough to keep using it and maybe given more time, the fine lines will fade away.
summary: Smooth and creamy and gives my skin a nice glow

reviewText: Really disappointed.  Streaky, way too sheer, and hardly any color.  Not at all what I expected from the pictures.  Went straight in the garbage.
You can't go wrong with Hot Tools!

I am a cosmetic and bath junkie, but also care about what ingredients are in my products.  I was concerned that Petrolatum is the 2nd ingredient listed.  I googled Petrolatum and what I read, confirmed my fears.

I just wish they'd not use Petrolatum as the 2nd ingredient after sugar :(
summary: Petrolatum is 2nd ingredient listed, not good.

reviewText: I guess I should have realized this would be yellow by having "chick" in the polish name. It didn't look that yellow on my phone. It's definitely yellow, not the neutral color I was expecting.
Another beautiful color, I am loving this.

I like everything about this except the price, which is why I gave it four stars instead of five.

It has an SPF of 25.  It combines chemical sunscreens such as Homosalate and Octisalate with physical sunscreen, titanium dioxide.
The tube dispenses a very fine line of product so you can precisely control how much you use.
The product goes on very smoothly and feels very good and moisturizing on the skin.
Coverage is pretty decent for a BB cream.  I put some on the back of one hand and compared with the other.  The hand with the product felt moisturized and softened for several hours. Freckles were slightly covered.

This cream has sparkles in it that are very apparent in the sun but not in shade.  You may or may not be OK with that.  I'm not sure whether the sparkles have something to do with the sun protection or are intended to have a light dispersion/cosmetic effect.

The medium shade that I received is more toward the golden sand end of the spectrum than the pinky beige.  Works well for me personally.  I think of myself as more fair than medium but the medium shade of this cream was fine for me.
The scent is noticeable but pleasant, mildly rose-floral.  Not a problem for me and I am very sensitive about fragrances.
I really like this quite a lot.  Too bad it costs so much.
summary: Quite like everything about this except the price.

reviewText: I really like the color of this balm. It is a very nice plum color. It goes on nicely and applies like butter. It is not tacky or sticky at all. What I didn't like was the very odd flavor - it is like a weird mix of old wood and ... peanuts? I knocked a star off due to the flavor. I know we don't eat it, but you constantly can taste it while you wear it. It makes me wear it less often, which is a bummer since the color and texture are so nice. It moisturizes fairly well and gives enough pigment for just a pop of color without looking too over done. If they change the flavor in it, it would be perfect - even more perfect in a tube since it is hard to get to the product if you have fingernails and of course you always have to wipe off your finger when you are done since it has color.
summary: Great color and texture, but odd flavor.

reviewText: All of there products are really great for men.  I highly recommend this one for all skin types even oily skin like mine
Fast delivery! Exactly what I was looking for. Thank you and will order again.

My fiancee likes to use this Aztec Healing Clay, which I've tried once and it was alright. Something more targeted for men would be nice, thus my choice of Baxter. Since I have oily, sensitive skin, I have just one demand of a healthy/beauty product - please don't mess up my skin and cause a reaction of some kind. So far, Baxter hasn't let me down. The directions say to apply a thin layer, but go ahead and be liberal with it if you don't mind running out of the product quicker. I feel like it's a better experience when the stuff is really caked on. Look at me, I've got mud on my face! Let it sit for like ten minutes and then rinse it off with warm water. It leaves my skin soft and (hopefully) purified. How my skin feels in winter will be the true test since this summer has been very humid.

Facial sunscreen and I have a bad relationship---chemical sunscreens make me itchy, blotchy, break out, you name it! I love that this sunscreen didn't do that, and it also didn't grease my face up. Since it's a physical sunscreen it will flash back on photos, so expect a washed out whitey blankness if you are doing photography in lower lighting.

No stinky fragrance, it feels more like skincare than sunscreen. I will buy this!
summary: If you are sensitive to chemical sunscreen try this

reviewText:
This facial cleanser (has a toner-like consistency, use on a cotton round) has no scent that I can detect. If there is fragrance it is so light as to be undetectable by me. It is pleasant on the skin and leaves my face clean and soft. While it did take my foundation makeup off,  it was less than successful with my eye makeup. I needed to use an oil based product to get my mascara off.

While I could use something more robust for summer, this is perfect for the winter skin care season. It is not drying and cleans without harshness. Easy to use, leak resistant container.
summary: Excellent gentle cleanser especially for fragile, winter skin. Just ok for eye makeup removal.

reviewText:
I have sensitive skin and a sensitive nose and because of that I don't like most fragrances and have to stay clear of anything oily or fruity (talking to you Garnier).

When it came to this Vichy serum I didn't know what to expect but I really like it.  It has virtually no smell and it is very light on your skin.  Hard to tell it's there at all.

I can't tell you how long the moisturizing lasts because I do wash my face ever day and my regimen is to put it on in the morning and at night -- mostly because with the onset of the beginning of Fall my skin has suddenly gone exceedingly, ridiculously dry.

The consistency is not a lotion.  It's definitely a serum, clear and white both and very liquid.  When you use it don't push the pump all the way down.  A little goes a long way.  A partial pump covers my entire face.

One thing I will note is that when I began using this serum my face was a winter disaster.  Already at the point where lotions irritated it and this serum was no exception.  It didn't 'hurt' my skin or cause breakouts, but it did burn a little bit. This wasn't because of the product though but because of the state of my dry, irritated skin.  After using this for a couple days that stopped happening.  Basically because my skin had caught up on moisture.

Worth trying.
Perfecto

This is one of the best blemish concealers I've tried so far.  It is easy to feather in with the skin surrounding the blemish without accidentally "uncovering" the concealed area.  The tube is pretty small, but it only takes a teeny tiny bit to be effective.  This is an in-between shade on the yellow & red spectrum, so it works with a wide variety of light complexions.

I have to say I kind of love this stuff.  I have a ton of hair and I am not always in the mood to blow every strand straight.  I allowed my hair to air dry and put about a quarter sized dollop of this stuff through it.  I should also add that we were at the beach all day, it was misting and my hair was wild!  I noticed that my hair became smoother without feeling slick or sticky. I loved what it did to my hair. My husband also used it and he had great results, too.

I think that this is a nice extra product to have on hand when you want smoother hair without a lot of work.

style: {'Size:': ' 1 Fl.  oz.', 'Style Name:': ' Calvin Klein euphoria Eau de Parfum'}
reviewText:
This perfume has a heavenly, sweet scent.  I receive compliments from my co-workers when I wear this fragrance.
In the summer it becomes especially fragrant from body heat.  The fragrance lasts until I wash it off. It has become a standard in my daily wear.

Another reviewed nailed it when she said the color is not what I expected.  Jasmine looks pink online so what a surprise to see a flesh-colored balm.  It is a truly hideous color on me and one that I never would've ordered if there was even a hint in the description that it would be flesh-toned.  I can't see that there's a way to salvage this color so will just toss it.  Money wasted.  So disappointed.
easy to go on and seems to be doing what it says it will do

I love this Shampoo, My hair has gone from frizzy ,dry, and unruly to being free of frizz and my style seems to stay in place,my hair is no longer dry and unmanageable. This Shampoo also leaves a nice shine a feeling that I just left my Hair Salon. I Normally use Alterna which  I like very much I personally think Alterna and Oribe  are very close in comparison my only problem is if I use a hair product to long the results aren't as good so I like to switch around every few months .I have other Oribe products I'm  using that are great to .I color my hair so thats,another reason I wanted to give this a try too. The scent is nice but like I said in another review I'm not looking for a scent I'm  looking for good results how well the product performs on my hair and that said I'm very happy with this Shampoo.
summary: The scent is nice but I look for results!

reviewText:
I'm pretty happy with this pencil. I like to have neat tidy eyebrows. I don't love the current eyebrow style that looks like 2x4s. I didn't want something too dark or waxy.

I love the color of this pencil. It's a softer brown really. But what I love is that it doesn't pull red. It has a nice neutral undertone. I think this is the first eyebrow pencil I've had in years that isn't too dark or too red. It makes a soft feathery line. It is buildable so if you are comfortable with a heavier brow, this is a good option. The spoolie is nice and also works for heavier or softer brows. This pencil stays put.
This is a must! Puts the St Tropez self tanner on smoothly, no streaks, no mess.
I'm impressed with how light weight and therefore easy to use this curler is.  It creates the gentle waves which are currently so popular.  It takes close to five minutes to fully heat up.
The color is pretty, after 3 or 4 coats, but it is more of a dull pink.  I expected it to be brighter.  I am a pink lover, so it worked.
summary: The color is a bit off

reviewText: seems to take the wrinkles out a little bit but certainly not worth the cost. got same results from less expensive products. results last a few hours, little longer so you have to re-apply often. just an ok product. hard to get out of tube initially.
Color is beautiful and as stated in description.  I have been looking for this type of blue polish for the longest time.  The polish goes on smoothly.  Great quality!

I'm a 50ish woman who has noticed thinning areas on the to of my head, this product has been wonderful for me, it covers,doesn't clump, run or even look like I'm wearing anything to disguise the area. I am so satisfied, I brought it over to my hairdresser, and she uses it on her clientele..There is one thing though, the bottom of the bottle is weighted and I'm never sure when I'm running low..wish they could address that...

style: {'Color:': ' 30N Sand Beige: For light skin with neutral undertones with a hint of yellow'}
reviewText: Full coverage  SPF 30. Love this product. I use it for those days in the sun to provide  a little coverage for my face. Especially pool days  and river days. I really like the texture  of the cream and it seems to stay  on pretty well even when I sweat. It comess with a little scraper that I don't use. I just use my makeup brushes to get it out.
summary: Great for light coverage on those river days!

reviewText:
I am a fan of cream blushes & have been using Ulta's Extreme Wear Cream Blush.  I am not a heavy make-up person, so the lightness of the cream blend suits my style.

The Jouer cream blush has a consistency similar to the Ulta cream blushes but comes with less product in the container (2g vs 5g).  It is fingertip application & goes on smoothly and blends well.  Lasting power seems to be equal to the Ulta Extreme Wear.

Color-wise, Petal has an underlying pink tone, but it still seems to work well with my slightly olive complexion.  With the Ulta, I combine the Nude Glow & Berry Glow to come up with the blend that is best for my face.

The Jouer tint is a very nice cream blush.  It is a little pricey per gram, but overall results are very positive.
summary: Nice Cream Blush. Blends Well. Lasts about as Long as Similar Cream Blushes

reviewText: made my hair soooooo dry and stiff. felt awful.

I really like how this white lotions absorbs into the skin.  Just let out a little of this (a dime size is enough)from the plastic squirt bottle and rub into the skin. It it will cover the hands and lower arms. It's lightly scented by the peanut oil, wheat germ oil and honey extract.  The oils dry fast on the skin and leave no greasy residue.  This lotion works very well on very dry skin.  My skin does not react badly to this lotion, but this does not mean that others may not, either.

This lotion is not tested on animals and is made in the USA.
Really like color but does have some glitter in it and I did not know it did... But looks pretty good!

TIZO Ultra Zinc Body & Face Sunscreen Non-Tinted SPF 40 Broad Spectrum is what I'm most comfortable putting on my face.  It's light and it quickly absorbs into the skin leaving a smooth and soft skin tone.  I used it on the beach this summer is loved it.

I recommend it!

I'm in my 30's with combination skin. Yes, I do have an expression line or two and I'd love to see it minimized, but the main draw for me was lightening acne scars. The product description here touts that benefit a bit more than the product box, which has one asterisk saying "may help reduce the appearance of acne scars" as a footnote to improved skin texture by 3 weeks of use. Since I was hoping to address blotchiness rather than texture issues, the box vs online description was discouraging to me for my particular concern.

After less than a week of use, I saw a definite increase in acne, where my products with retinol and AHA had been keeping it almost entirely cleared up. (I added the serum to my routine and didn't discontinue the others.) After discontinuing use of this serum, my breakout has begun to clear, so I'm attributing the breakout to the serum. This isn't shocking since it does contain oils.

Also, if you're in contact with sensitive nut allergy sufferers, be aware that it does contain macadamia nut oil and do your own research as to the likely safety.

Overall, the breakout issue will probably not apply to many people, but if you're acne prone you may want to look for something else.

style: {'Color:': ' 70W Olive Brown: For tan to deep skin with warm undertones and a hint of bronze'}
reviewText: This color is a bit darker than I thought it would be but it's an awesome light weight full coverage foundation.  I like that it is more of a foam than a cream... The cream they have can be a bit heavy...this is a bit more light weight.  Overall only need one application.  Great coverage.

I've always liked Ahava products and this hand cream is another winner in my opinion. Not only does this cream make hands feel smooth for the moment, but it actually seems to help heal dried and cracked skin. In my case, I have to wash my hands a lot due to working on various projects around the house. This cream not only helps soften skin, but it helps protect my hands for a couple of washings before needing re-application. It does this without making my fingers greasy or slimy like some cheaper brands can.

On top of that, the smell is mild, and a little goes a long ways for me - I can use about half or less of the amount of other less expensive creams.

Check it out - you'll never want to go back to your old stuff.
I've been using this stuff religiously and it has made a tremendous difference in my skin.  I get compliments all the time.

I have the Proraso green label shaving cream, as well as the red in addition to this.  This is how they stack up:

The green is the baseline, general purpose shaving cream, and it is nice.  The menthol feeling is soothing.

The red is for thicker beard growth and is my favorite, the cream really works good for heavy growth and the sandalwood is a wonderfully enjoyable scent.

This white shaving cream is for sensative skin and for that purpose it works quite well.  It lathers easily and heavily and the additives (oatmeal and something else) do leave my skin feeling soft and moisturized.  Its a great shaving cream, and will be a noticable step up if you've only ever used Barbasol or any of the aerosol gel stuff they sell at a corner store.

I can say that about the other two types as well.  I like the red tube the best, but any Proraso shaving cream I've tried has been excellent!  Give it a shot, you may never look back!
its a good thing all brushes fit on the SMART CLARISONIC, I thought this was the kind with the chip---NOT  it works anyway, i'll be more careful next time when ordering!!!
summary: Wish the description would tell which device the brushes are for----CLARISONIC

reviewText: Love Essie and i Love this color...One of my favorites
Love this stuff! After just one use my skin looks less shockingly pale. Only negative to me is that I don't love the smell.

I received a sample of this product and the fragrance was so lovely, I ordered a bottle.  I am very pleased.  The fragrance is not overpowering and lasts for some time.  It has a floral scent, which is heavenly.  You cannot go wrong with this product.
i didn't like too much this color, but is as shown in the bottle, i use them in my salon but people doesn't ask for this color so i will not buy again
See description above. The London Butter nail lacquer that I purchased from their company is 100% fantastic!!  But, the London Butter nail lacquer that I purchased  from Shop Adorn was disgusting!!
summary: Shop Adorn's polish was pasty, thick and left streaks on my nail which I couldn't cover = pink-white-pink-white-... stripes. Yuck

reviewText: I'm a huge Mario Badescu fan and this cream doesn't disappoint. I have normal to dry skin. My skin still feels nice and moisturize in the morning when I wake up.

Has floral scents with a dash of nutmeg and spice.  Of course, the smell varies for everyone but I found it a little too overpowering for my tastes.  You do get quite a bit of the liquid, and I've taken a photo next to a 12oz can of soda for comparison purposes.  Overall, not bad for the price.
summary: Floral scent, a little too overpowering for me

reviewText: Smells clean, works to keep my skin moist after washing and before applying moisturizer.  Good product.  A facial therapist introduced me to this line of skin care.  They know best, right?

This review is from: Clarisonic Replacement Brush Head Twin Pack for Acne Cleansing (Misc.)
Ordered the DEEP PORE CLEANSING BRUSHES and some one threw the wrong brushes into the box. Well accidents happen. Amazon said this 'product is not from them' and caused me loads of grief and aggravation in trying to rectify their error. Calls, letters and a trip to the post office.........not what I expected from you guys. I bought tons of stuff and wonder why your customer service was non existent now?
I think you owe me.
Buyer beware --- is it Amazon or a sub contractor? Big difference in how you are treated.

I have never tried any type of device like this on my skin before. I am older and have avoided wrinkles but I do have textural issues that came with menopause. I felt like my face became a mine field of irregular rough patches and age spots.  Bought this, the basic model, to try it out. I've been quite pleased.

My skin looks smoother and more even with just a few uses. Once imoisturize I am startled st the improvement. Far less noticeable rough or flaky skin. Age spots look less bumpy.  Had a difficult time using this around my nose (the vibration made me sneeze) and this model only gas a single speed do I can't low it down. I also felt for the price the charge cord should come with a plug.

Overall I am very pleased with the results. I look and feel like I had a facial. I have sensitive skin but this device has been gentle and non-irritating. Like it more than I anticipated.
summary: I was skeptical but my face really looks better.

reviewText:
The best part about this product is that you don't have to worry about it for a long length of time-it lasts for around 80 minutes per application. I was hoping it would have a more lotion like feel to it but it was rather harsh. My wife and I did not care for the smell of it-which is a big issue for me because that is the first thing I test with any of these new products is the smell-the stronger the smell the better that I like it. Also the price was high for the amount that you were given.

Not a terrible product but nothing to write home about.
summary: Did not care for the smell...

reviewText:
This is another gentle, dependable product in the array of Mustela products we consistently use in our home. We used them on our toddler grandson right off the bat, and funny enough I was looking at a baby picture of my nephew from the 90's and spotted a Mustela bottle in the background. Let's say it's a family tradition, lol.  We like knowing the ingredients are pure and Mustela's performance is tried and true. This is the first time I've tried this product and I was not surprised it lived up to the standard I expected.

At what point do people say "you're old enough to start using harsh chemicals on your body!"? I'm baffled by this and have always tried to steer toward natural and/or baby products for myself too. I like their gentleness and love the way they smell. I've always been a fan of Mustela's signature scent, which is included in most of their products. Some people find it strong, and in fact I even feel it's too strong in certain products for babies. Not the case with this "gel" (more like liquid soap). This is a gentle cleanser, it's easy on my skin, leaves it soft and carrying a pleasant wisp of fragrance. Used with an unscented moisturizer, it's perfect for those who wish for just a hint of scent. All-in-all, I think this fragrance is a love-or-hate thing. If you love the scent you will love this.

This is a basic, wholesome product which is probably what all of us should be using on our skin. I don't wash my hair with it, but we love the 2-in-1 for our grandson. It leaves his curls soft and smelling irresistible.
summary: Great for babies and adults too!

reviewText: The color is a fun, bright summer color.  Neon without being ridiculous.  However, it was very thick and not smooth.  It was difficult to put on smoothly.  It also took three coats and dries matte.  I put a top coat on so its shiny anyway. It's ok, not great.
summary: Fun Summer Color but hard to put on

reviewText: My favorite ...has been since I was a teen. A must have in your beauty routine. :D
My salon uses Essie products and they work well on my thin, dry nails.  I bought several colors.

I hope they make this product for a long time.  My hair has thinned out a lot, with this product you can not tell.
If you are thinning, this well make you feel better and look great, really!
I will buy it until something better comes along.
This moisturizes well.

I bought one a long time ago and returned it due to the sticky handle problem so it was with concern that I bought a second one but the handle was good.  This is one of the few curling irons that is the size I want - 5/8".  It arrived just in time to take it to Spain. It worked well.  The only thing I didn't like is it was too long to fit in my cosmetic bag which I keep packed and ready to go since I travel regularly.
I liked this product a lot. I do think it was good for my lashes, but it was too expensive so I tried another brand.
summary: Would have used again if the price was better

reviewText: Great nude pink shade. Definitely for daily wear.

By far the best treatment for ingrown hair I have ever used. Not just for the face, it works quickly and easily. I have never found something that truly gets to the root of the problem and heals, but this definitely does. Recommend 100%.
summary: By far the best treatment for ingrown hair I have ever used

reviewText: I have very sensitive, reactive skin that tends to be dry on my cheeks.  I use this and it has taken the redness out of my cheeks, I rarely have to wear any makeup now except a quick brush of powder.  I use this with the Rebalance and then top off with Silk Balm just on my cheeks to counteract the dryness my cheeks experience.  PCA has been the best thing that has happened to my skin for a decade.
Great shampoo and body wash that leaves your hair and skin feeling moisturized with the unique pleasant smell of Nordic Wood that helps you escape away.
Awesome shampoo love the smell and a little dab soaps up your whole head great product glad I purchased it.

This is the strangest tanner Ive ever used. Its really nice in the color and scent but it is very high maintenance in application. The texture is more like a gel and its dark brown right out of the bottle. It kind of reminds of Hersheys chocolate syrup coming out. Its very scary to put something that dark on my fair skin. You definitely get some instant color when you apply it. It is nice to see where you're applying the tanner and to get some instant color but it was really hard to get it even. I had to go back over it with a tanning mitt to really buff it in.

You don't get that awful self tanning scent. The scent is actually really nice.

The color doesnt look as dark as it does right out of the bottle. It blends into a natural looking tan. The nice thing is that the color isn't orange, it has a more of cool tone dark brown shade than orange which is definitely more natural looking.
summary: Nice Toned Shade But Hard to Apply, Nice Scent

reviewText: This base polish works very well with any polish.  It helps protect the nails and keeps the polish from chipping longer.  This has a very light pink tint and does not take away from the polish color at all.

There are a lot of positives to this product.  I've been using this product for several weeks now and have never experience the burning sensation which other reviewers noted; however, it must be noted that I do not have particularly sensitive skin, either.  I have combination skin, so take that as you will.

If I apply this after my normal cleansing ritual and before applying moisturizer, it does reduce the look of fine lines (and I'm a former smoker, so I'm always happy to reduce the appearance of wrinkles which prematurely aged my skin through my own folly), but the effect does not seem to be permanent and fades after a few hours. Which isn't the worst thing that a product like this can do.

I've tried several beauty serums - mostly free samples - and thus far have not found one which works on my skin to produce the purported effects which the marketing departments claim.  On the other hand, this serum is organic and not full of nasty chemicals. It has a pleasant scent which I did not find overpowering.  It is also not oily and did not make me break out, as many of the beauty serums have done in the past, so I consider that a win, as well.

Although I do not believe that this serum has had a permanent age-reversing effect on my skin, as a temporary measure, it works very well. The one thing I don't particularly like about this serum is that my face feels sticky after application, which is slightly unsettling. But this does not interact with my moisturizer, primer or foundation makeup, so it's just a mild inconvenience. Overall, for this price (which is slightly below the upper market products on Sephora), this is a decent addition to one's skin care regimen, though I do not feel that the effects are long-lasting, so you should consider that before you purchase.

I got this for my wife who is always looking to try new cleansing products.
The Crepe Erase scrub is really nice.  6 oz. might not sound like a lot, but you get a LOT of product in the tube and a little goes a long way.  Also, when you put it on your face (about a quarter size is plenty for the whole face), it foams up slightly so that it spreads all over easily.  The beads that comprise the scrub are large.  The product isn't packed with the scrub beads, but there are enough to do the trick.  It washes off easily, and my skin definitely looked freshly scrubbed and felt super smooth. It has a very nice smell: maybe slightly floral, slightly fruity.  Not overwhelming, but there.
summary: A lot goes a long way

reviewText: This is a great color. It goes on thick and doesn't leave streaks like other nude colors. I did two coats and I was very pleased with the turnout of this color!
Everyone loves this color, and my coworker borrowed it yesterday for a special occasion!

"Nia" stands for niacin, and if you search PubMed, you'll find that the doctors who founded Niadyne, creators of the Nia24 skin care line, have conducted extensive peer-reviewed research on the effects of niacin, and specifically niacin+retinol. If you want to use skincare that is backed by scientific evidence and a devoted fanbase, Nia24 deserves a place on your list.

As a longtime retin-a user who has no problem with the hard stuff, I really like this cream: the consistency, the mild scent, even the sturdy silver tube that is easy to spot in dim light. It's one of the few products I've tried that keeps working all night, so that I wake up without dry skin. My skin has improved dramatically in the last three weeks since I started using IRR, but that is probably due to the non-ablative laser treatment I had a couple of weeks ago. It may take me another month to decide whether this is a product I'll want to keep using, and that $130 pricetag is something of a deterrent, as reflected in a one-star deduction. If the choice were between a few tubes of this and a laser treatment, I know where I'd put my money.

IRR is not a miracle worker, and you're not going to wake up after a week looking 21, unless you happened to be 21 when you went to bed. But it's an effective moisturizer that hits a lot of the right notes in face care.

This is an awesome, gentle toner. I have very fair, sensitive aging skin ('m 53) and I have no trouble using this product daily. I also use the other seaweed products by MB, and they are wonderful as well, especially the seaweed night cream.

This oil provides hydration to my dry skin.  A little goes a long way, so this bottle will last awhile.  I noticed a difference in using it.  My skin felt softer.  I used it after exfoliating, so I could get the complete benefit.  It didn't irritate my skin, and it has a pleasant scent.  I like it.
Thick creamy eye cream! It broke out surrounding areas of my face but not my undereyes. Be careful it doesn't spread to other areas of your face while sleeping or working out (sweating), etc.
summary: Nice for undereyes and above eyes only.

reviewText: What I thought it would be
Feels like antiseptic lotion. Not hip on it. Won't buy again. However it's a large tube
I like it ... color does not look like the picture though it's a lot darker

This is my 2nd Juice Beauty Product.  The 1st I used is the Green Apple Peel Sensitive which I love!  When I find a product I love, I always like to try other products from the brand.  I received a generous sample of the Flouride Hydratant Anti-age Moisturizer, said to reduce wrinkles with firming peptides.

I am naturally drawn to any product that says "firming peptides".  I'm in my 30's, my skin is starting to sag a little bit and needs a little boost.  This product is made with Certified Organic Ingredients, another plus.  It also contains alpha lipoic acid, CoQ10 (a firming agent), Vitamin C, peptides and DMAE.  It sounds like a really great product.

The very first time I used it, I didn't like the smell.  It didn't smell like apples or like the peel at all.  To me, it smells like a regular Jergens lotion mixed with a hint of a clay mask.  I also found this moisturizer to be very thick and heavy.  I started applying it at night only to see how it would feel on my skin.  Right away my skin felt heavy and greasy.  I have natural oily skin so this was a bad combination for me.  When I woke up the next morning my face felt like an oil slick.  To give the product a fair shot, I used it again in the am, under makeup, which was a total disaster.  I applied my liquid foundation over top and because the product had never fully absorbed, rather sat on top of the skin, my skin was so sticky all day.  I felt like my face was so dirty.

The price point, in my opinion is very high too.  For $45, I have found many other moisturizers that work better on my oily skin.  This product may be good for someone with really dry skin that needs super duper moisture, but for a girl with oily skin, it's no good.
summary: Too Thick and Heavy, Caused My Face to Be Greasy

reviewText:
Sometimes it is hard to differentiate what any one NIA24 product does, especially when using several of them every day.  The one thing that I have noticed since adding this to my cleaning and moisturizing routine is that my face is noticeably softer and stronger.  It is kind of interesting because I always think of my grandmothers soft skin when I touch mine, but hers was soft and paper thin.  Mine is soft and strong.  It feels great.

I have always been taught to put moisturizers on in the order of thickness, starting with eye creams and then the thinnest.  In order to do that with NIA24 products, I always start by putting several on the back of my left hand.  The skin on the back of my left hand is gorgeous.

I like the feeling of it being protected from the elements even before the yard work and sailing seasons start.
Great product!!! Covers thinning area very well!

I switched to Jack Black's Wax Pomade after trying Clay Pomade. The Clay Pomade had a stronger hold but was extremely sticky and hard to apply.

Wax Pomade is an awesome product especially due to the addition of tea tree and sage leaf oils which are good for your scalp. The hold is fairly strong but flexible. If you need to re-style, simply use water and run a comb through your hair and you'll be good as new.

For comparison, I've used everything from American Crew, Paul Mitchell, Uppercut, Bumble & Bumble, and Kiehl's. Jack Black really blew away the competition with this one.
effective with minimal results

This is my first encounter with a L'Occitane product and I have to say that I am a fan so far. The moisturizer is thinner than most I've been using lately, but it does not leave a greasy footprint like the thicker options. The formula feels very loose and liquid-y, almost as if it were water-based. A small dab - about the size of half a non-shooter marble - is enough for a foot and calf. A little goes a long way here.

The fragrance is probably the biggest love-it-or-hate-it point. The fragrance is very strong in a "insistent" sort of way. I don't find it overwhelming, but you won't forget that it's there. It does remind me of almonds in a drinkable almond milk sort of way. However for those calling the scent chemically, I can see that too. It doesn't smell natural, but it doesn't smell wholly artificial to me either.

Performance-wise, I am a fan. The moisturizer soaks in quickly and works for at least 24hrs between showers. My skin is soft and I do not find myself needing to reapply as the day goes on. Having said that the scent isn't offensive, I wouldn't suggest using this as a face cream - the smell is probably too much for that proximity to your nose.
summary: First time with a L'Occitane product, and I am a fan

reviewText:
Great color shine and dry time I like it
I would definitely purchase this item again and recommend it to others.
I love this. It smells fresh and clean but isn't TOO aquatic or floral.  If you like jasmine you'll like this.  It's a very summery scent.

First the color:
Looks fuchsia in the tube but on my pigmented lips it has a Violet tinge. Nice bright shade for the summer
Finish: not glossy, not matte. A very nice natural finish
Color payoff: nice intensity with one swipe, two swipes gets you intense color
Formula: Lovely! Not drying, but wouldn't call this super moisturizing, very comfortable wear.l
Wear time: 4 hours with some fading
No scent and no flavor.

Overall a nice formula but $$ seems steep, so one star deducted.
If it was not for the price, I would definitely buy other colors.
it does works !!!

style: {'Color:': ' 50C Honey Beige: For tan skin with cool undertones'}
reviewText:
We received three of these shades as a trial, along with one tube of the mousse. The mousse was much easier to apply, and that's the product we'd purchase in the future. Other reviewers (and the company's marketing copy) mention the 30 SPF, but the label says if you are using it for that purchase you have to reapply it at least every two hours!!!!!

"For sunscreen use: apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure; reapply at least every two hours; use a water resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating."

This is obviously in direct contrast to their push that it lasts 16 hours with the powder (which we did not use).

The application is a bit fiddly; the mousse goes right on, but these require a scoop (included, but don't lose it)---it doesn't store with the product well. Then you have to warm it in your hands and apply it. It does have a mask-type feel. All of the shades we received seemed darker than expected.

My daughter is in the theater, and these will be fine on the stage or other situations where the lights make you look washed out, but it will not be something we'll purchase again.
summary: Apply every 2 hours for sun protection!!! Darker than expected

reviewText: Best skin cleanser I've found.  And I've tried hundreds - from drugstore to high end.  It's gentle, smells good, but dissolves the "issues" I have on my face, which are adult cystic acne and Lichen Planus which is really problematic at times.  It's the only cleanser I will use forever and ever.  Mario Badescu gears their skincare products (or I should say a good portion of them) to people with problematic skin, such as rosacea, cystic acne, and I believe they can add Lichen Planus to the list.  It's helped me so much.  That and the Drying Cream, Silver Powder, Healing and Soothing Mask, and Flower and Tonic Mask.  Best line ever.  AND so inexpensive for what you get.

I'm a woman in my 40s who has switched to shave soaps & a brush after years of canned foam. The Proraso green soap/croap is my favorite, and the white is very similar. Both are more of a "croap" (cross between hard cream & soap) rather than a straight up hard puck of soap. It lathers crazy easily with a wet badger or boar brush & the "Marco method" (if you're new to wet shaving or having trouble making lather, google it - you won't regret it), and provides a good, close, irritation-free shave. I lather in the plastic Proraso bowl directly on the soap, then go straight to leg. I have also done a separate bowl lather with this, and it worked nicely. After use I leave the lid off for a couple of hours to let the soap dry somewhat (I shave in the shower & store my soap there, so there's a lot of water) and then store it with the lid on. The white has a slight menthol feel, but considerably less than the green. In my opinion, the white has a light scent of roses & fresh cut grass. It's very light and clean, and I think it could be considered the most "feminine" between the green, red & white Proraso soaps. I had issues with irritation from the red Proraso (disappointing, since I loved the scent), but neither the green or the white cause any problems for me. Overall I am extremely pleased with this soap and it will definitely be in my regular rotation.

Probably this is good for women but definitely not for men.
This is not for men, that's for sure
Great colour and lasts.

This rates 5 stars because the color is extraordinary...I thought it was a navy but it's a slightly softer blue color and it has a slight glittery effect.  Love the way it looks!
I love the Shellac products and this new color allows me to switch out the pinks, french tips, etc. with a more dramatic nighttime look.
I would recommend this to any of the ladies who love to have beautiful hands and nails.  My daughters-in-law even liked it
 and that's a high recommendation!
Use this product once a week! It takes a few coats, but it dries fast and always looks professional! No need for bottom coat! Love this color. Very good for work and night out!
summary: Easy application; Dries Fast; No need for bottom coat; Beautiful, professional color

reviewText:
great shampoo. really great for dry, thin hair. I have alot of hair, but it is fine, and it is hard to find a hair product that keeps my hair moisturized. love this shampoo, but it will burn your eyes. tingles when you use it.
I used another shampoo after this, and it left my hair dull and weak. this shampoo is the best!
Perfect pink! This nail polish also doesn't seem to dry out as fast as others.

I have the definition of porcelain skin. It is fairer than fair. Now, that's all well and good, but for the occasional gathering, I would like a little more "warmth." I was hoping this would give me that kiss of color that I need. But, instead it came out a little on the orange side ... which has been the same experience I have had with considerably less expensive products. Now, both the goods news and the bad news is that it was gone very quickly (under two days). This is good for me, but maybe bad for someone who wants a longer lasting product. (Now, this could also be a result of fairly aggressive skincare regimen). If anything, I might avoid using your Clarisonic while trying to develop some color.

For me, I think I am just too pale for these products to ever look normal. But, I think if you had medium skin, it might add depth.

Essie's The Lace Is On is a beautiful color and has become one of my favorites. Nice cross between purple and magenta with some shimmer (but not glitter) that adds depth to it. Sophisticated color suitable for all ages.
summary: Gorgeous color: The Lace Is On

reviewText: Works well. Lasts a long time. Make sure you purchase a good moisturizer to use with this product as it really dries out your skin.
summary: Make sure you purchase a good moisturizer to use with this product as it really ...

reviewText: This looks shiny in the picture but it is really flat. I haven't worn this color yet because of that. One day I might try it but its the holiday season now and I want cheerful looking nails.
summary: This looks shiny in the picture but it is really ...

reviewText: Works really well. It says it's for styling hair too but it's not a holding product but a good spray for wetting and fixing bed head for example.
summary: It says it's for styling hair too but it's not a holding product but a good spray for wetting and fixing bed head for example

reviewText: Great colors for blondes, but the shadows are very frosted. They look matte in the pan, but, in fact, they are quite shimmery on the lids. It's a bit much to use four frost shadows at once. So while I like the colors, I don't like all the shine.
summary: all four colors are frost shadows

reviewText:
After a few weeks of using this serum in the morning and evening, I have noticed a softening of lines around my eyes and forehead.  I would not say the effect is remarkable at this point, but it is apparent.  The use so far seems to indicate that continued use will lead to further softening of lines and healthier appearing skin. I have not experienced any side effects, and I would categorize my skin and eyes as being sensitive.

I think for consumers the question is whether the potential for a noticeable benefit is worth the additional cost of this product over a traditional moisturizer.
summary: This Serum Seems to Have a Positive Benefit to Facial Skin

reviewText:
So, until I read specifically about Baxter, I didn't realize this Clay Mask was made for men.  Apparently Baxter of California produces and sells a line of products for men.

That did not stop this woman from trying out the clay mask.  I am a big fan of clay masks, I have combination skin and I like to feel pampered with clay.

This is a white clay, and it is very light.  A little goes a long way, and I rinsed my face prior to applying the clay.  It worked great, even as light and thin as it was.  I washed it off after the suggested drying time, and my skin felt nice and clean.

I was also very impressed that my skin didn't get oily after the fact either.  I loved this mask, and may not ever let the hubby know that it was really a men's product.

While I don't pretend to know what about 1/2 the ingredients are, I am impressed with the other half - things like Aloe, Avocado Oil, Witch Hazel, Calendula Oil (those are not exactly how they are written, but I do recognize those ingredients).
summary: Nice Clay Mask - Made For Men

reviewText: First impression of Eternity Now deodorant was good enough, it was nice scent, a clear stick that goes on clear.  The stick is circular and after using it I realize while others are oblong shaped because those I can do one wipe up and down to get enough coverage, but with this circular shape I felt like I had to swipe four or five time to get complete coverage.  Then I tried this on a Sunday and but by the fourth quarter of the football game I noticed the scent starting to fade which is not good for a big brand name deodorant when some cheap general store bought brand usually last until bedtime.  I guess this is fine to put on before a dinner party (it would probably go well with some Calvin Klein cologne too) but it is not very good if you are putting in a long days work, or even a lazy Sunday in front of the television.
summary: Decent Scent; Not Very Long Lasting

reviewText: Traditionally, I use a pencil or crayon type eyeliner. This was my first real/serious try with liquid liner. I think I tried it once when I was in college (punk rock was the rage), but it was awkward, a little messy and took longer than the pencil. But now, years later, when offered the opportunity to try this product for my honest opinion, I thought why not? I don't regret it and overall, Im pleased with bliss On the Line Liquid Liner. After a little practiceok a lotI was able to line my eyes without looking like a clown. The applicator is thin but you can make a thicker/bolder line by tilting the applicator. What I liked: (1) this eyeliner dries quickly and doesnt smear (at least not that I noticed). I didn't get raccoon eyes and had a pretty polished look. (2) This liner comes off easily. I simply use a gentle face cleanser and it comes off pretty easily. (3) This product doesnt irritate the eye. So why not 5 stars. Well, there is one drawback. (1) This liquid liner is a little pricey (0.016 fl oz for approximately $24). And while I like the product, I am a little torn. As a consumer on a budget, I am not sure if I would purchase this product, especially if I can find a comparable product at my local drug or discount store. I would have a hard time justifying the cost.
summary: Exciting product just not sure I can justify the cost.

reviewText: good
My very picky husband loves this shave cream, prefers this green label product to their red label product for the scent.

This product is absolutely amazing! I have very fine blonde and gray hair that's just below my ears. I was seriously going to have it cut short because it always looked  like cotton candy..flyaway with no body. The only way i could make it look good was to laboriously put curlers in it. With this shampoo, combined with the even more amazing Lanza Combing Cream (which I just re-ordered, because I don't EVER want to run out!) all I need is my hot brush and a few minutes. I get a smooth "do" with plenty of shine and body.
I'll be darned .. it really works.  Dark circles (decades old) are diminished, all but gone!  And fast .. it's remarkable.

This contour palette is made well, has a good color selection. The mirror is a nice touch for travel.

This palette can also be used for natural looking eyeshadow. The colors are creamy and matte, lightweight yet with good coverage. There is also quite a bit of product in this palettes so it will last longer.

Really good product for hold and a neat appearance. I grew up in a time when pomades were out of fashion, but I like the look and thanks to shows like Mad Men for making it stylish again. Works well on dry and slightly damp hair but did not perform as well with a blow dryer. This is best for men with shorter hair. Quality product.
Bought this for my dad because he has oily, acne roseacia skin. He loves it! It smells nice and revives the skin while getting rid of the oil. Just don't get it in your eyes cause u will be sorry!

Very interesting product.  It arrives in an attractive box (almost gift quality).  Inside are small capped vials intended to provide one application.  There is also a "dropper" that screws onto the bottle (with cap removed) to dab your scalp with the "liquid".  Similar to dying your hair/roots.

The enclosed instructions are woefully incomplete.  Basically says, "make three straight lines down your scalp" (and massage in).  Three lines?  Where...side-to-side?  front-to-back?  There are youtubes available, but I wasn't in the mood to sit through a video when I just wanted to test the product.  So I focused on the areas of where my hair is thinning the most and then randomly dabbed, massaged in, added my usual small amount of gel & leave-in conditioner and partially blow-dried.

If I use too much in one area, the combination of my hair and the liquid leaves my hair feeling somewhat clumped and like it's dirty (my fault).  If I'm patient, it absorbs well.  My hair did "feel" like it was more full upon drying (though that isn't part of its claim).

Recommended to use three times to freshly washed damp hair (and then dry as usual) per week.

I'm skeptical these days, but after two weeks (9 applications), something DOES FEEL different.  I know that isn't scientific and vague, but I'm still curious to see the results after a month's use.  (and I will update then)

Where I can definitely feel a difference is when I condition (after shampoo) and rinse out the conditioner, I have nowhere near the hair in my hands than before using this product.  The claim is that it anchors the hair to the follicle ~ and to that note, I do have far less hair loss after conditioning/rinsing.

Recommended is 3 months use and if my results continue in this positive direction, I feel encouraged to purchase two more sets at their pricey amount.  My hair, with age and thyroid issues, has thinned a lot over the past few years and I'd love to slow that down (or stop it).  Interesting product.

First, please note that you have to be careful when you read the reviews because this product page has lumped several completely different products together, so the reviews are not for one product. This makes it difficult to find reviews for specific products or judge an accurate star rating per product. My review is for iS CLINICAL Cleansing Complex.

I've been using iS CLINICAL Cleansing Complex for about two weeks. It cleanses very well and removes all of my makeup. It suds just enough and feels a little foamy when combined with warm water. I like that part of it. However, each time I use it, my face is left feeling very dry and uncomfortable. I feel that I need extra moisturizer to combat the drying effect of this cleanser.

I think I would have loved this cleanser when I was younger and had oily skin. Now that I'm older, and have dry skin, this cleanser removes too much facial oil for it to benefit my skin. Once again, I do like that way that it quickly removes my makeup and it's easy to rinse off. However, it's just not for me.
summary: Cleansing complex dries my skin, but it does remove all traces of makeup.

reviewText: good

Ten stars! Yes, for my problem this product gets 10 stars. At first, I used this serum on my face thinking it would eliminate the minor redness I get on my cheeks when I drink even a single glass of wine. It had no effect. So I was about to join the naysayers when it occurred to me to try the serum on my arms where I've had this awful rash FOR YEARS. My dermatologist has tried endless diagnostic techniques (allergy tests, biopsies, microscopic analyses, etc.), has prescribed prednisone, steroid creams, UV therapy, OTC creams, etc. and has never been able to get me relief for more than a couple of hours. She has never even been able to give a name to the rash, just says it is not rosacea or psoriasis. I have been miserable for years. Sounds melodramatic unless you've had a life-damaging skin problem, but if you've suffered too, you understand.

I applied the tiniest drop of Rosaliac AR Intense to my rash and the itching stopped immediately. Frankly, that didn't impress me because almost any lotion will stop the itching for a few minutes or even a couple of hours. What I needed was something that would stop the itching and calm the rash so I could get a full night's sleep. Well, that first night I got a full night's sleep. In the morning the itching still had not come back. After my next shower, I applied a few drops again and the rash and itching remain gone. I continue to be able to sleep and to go through the day without any itching. I frankly cannot believe it, so if you're skeptical I don't blame you. But it's true.

If this serum stops working, I will definitely update this review because I don't want anyone to have false hope as I've had so many times. This serum is too expensive to purchase just to find it's ineffective. I believe the reviewers who say it didn't work for them. But I can swear to you that it is working for me.
summary: 10 stars! It cured my rash & redness (which is not rosacea)

reviewText: Very thick; color is a very bright "cooked salmon" color.  Like the lightest part of cooked salmon only really, really bright and then add the thick and uneven texture of the product itself and it is just awful!  My mom loves orange, coral, salmon and just about any combination of orange there is but hated this color and I did too.  I have purchased several and this is the absolute worst!  It is a shame that you cannot return bad product.
Beautiful, smooth applying color.
Leaves my face feeling clean.
summary: I like the smell and leaves my face super clean

reviewText: I've used Prorasco shaving products for ages - even with the modern shaving market coming back into style with luxury goods and services, Proraso managed to hold its own in large part due to the simplicity and superiority of a proven product line. However, even I have to admit, as much as I enjoy the brand, there are times when you don't want a fragrance that your grandfather used. This seems to be the entry into the modern era and it's a good one...the fragrance alone is superb. Same simplicity of ingredients, same attention to detail, refreshing updated fragrance. Good stuff!
summary: Modern twist on a classic brand

reviewText:
This is my favorite Billy Jealousy face wash I have used.

I like the consistency of this face wash vs the bar none face wash. This is thicker and seems to suds up better. This does not leave my face dry but neither did the bar none face wash. This has a nice smell to it and washes off cleanly. I feel like I get more uses out of a bottle vs the thinner bar none face wash.

I will definitely be using this face wash from now on.
I ordered one color and they sent me a different one. Luckily I liked the color they sent me but it just wasn't the one I ordered. It came on time thought

The color looks just as good on as it does in the bottle (if you use a super shiny topcoat), but the formula is pretty awful. It went on super gloopy and dried extremely fast making it hard to work with. And despite my buffer, base coat, and Seche Vite top coat, the polish chipped the next day. It reminds me of Butler Please... gorgeous color, but don't expect it to last more than one day on your nails.

style: {'Color:': ' 35W Toast: For medium skin with warm undertones and a hint of gold'}
reviewText: I'm excited to find a Dermablend cosmetic that I can wear without causing skin irritation. This Toast colored powder covers well. It left my complexion with a hint of the appearance of a tan. This is a medium coverage build-able base powder I apply with a powder brush. I then set it with mineral water. Also, the compact comes with a thin sponge for a more intense application. Overall I like this product. It provides good coverage.

I tried this out on my husband and it was something he liked. It's not like a greasy moisturizer at all. It reminds me of Smashbox's Skin Primer that I use under foundation.  After a shave, it felt really nice on his skin. Since he doesn't use anything on his skin normally, not even sunscreen, I've been trying to get him to do better. We are middle-aged now and need the help. I've given him a multitude of products that he ignores. He doesn't like the greasy feel or shine.

This fit the bill perfectly.

It does contain "cones" or those ingredients some people hate and consider them bad for their skin. I've not had a problem with them. It aids to that smooth feeling. Ingredient list below.  It's for sensitive skin and it is very concentrated so a pea-sized drop did his whole face.

One caveat, if you haven't recently shaved, it may not feel as good. It seems great on fresh shaved skin.

aqua/water/eau, glycerin, pentylene glycol, glycolic acid, polyacrylamide, dimethicone, sodium hydroxide, cetearyl alcohol, c13-14 isoparaffin, cetyl alcohol, ammonium acryloyldimethyltaurate/vp copolymer, c12-14 isoparaffin, phenoxyethanol, xanthan gum, parfum/fragrance, c13-16 isoparaffin, laureth-7, cetearyl glucoside, polysilicone-11, c13-15 alkane, tocopheryl acetate, disodium edta, limonene, beta-glucan, 1,2-hexanediol, caprylyl glycol, linalool, benzoic acid, sodium benzoate, citral, geraniol, bht.
summary: Maybe husband will use this for once!

reviewText: Very soft and a little goes a long way.  Applies smoothly and evenly on the skin, no heavy blotches especially around the lower lip of the eye.  I didn't have to reapply another layer to even out the coolor.  So easy to use and helped with minimising those bags under the eyes, until you caught up with your sleep.  My complexion is semi olive tone and this worked, but the next shade up works the best.  Held up for full work day, no humidity Under cold weather conditions.
summary: One application and the job is done..nice and light.

reviewText: I LIKE THIS SHADE OF GREEN. CAN'T wait to use it .
Good wearability

The color is a beautiful dark pink berry color, not a dark color but for pinks, considered dark. The formula is great and super easy to work with and very shiny. I can decide if this polish is a creme or jelly so ill go with crelly.

I am not a tanner of any type...sun, chemical, spray, self. I am a pale human. I am attending a wedding and was trying to see if I could avoid wearing stockings, which I hate. I am not given to time consuming personal care regimes so this was out of my norm. I followed all of the directions and although I find this process quite tedious, it did work very well. With very careful application, my legs look uniformly tan. The product smells good and was not irritating in any way.

I am unlikely to use this regularly because of the time demands but I was pleased with the outcome.
summary: Instant tan....requires deliberate and careful application. Works though!

reviewText: I am very happy with this Mario Badescu Silver powder. The product can be messy, I have found using a flat makeup brush helps with the application process. Make sure to wear old clothes as the product turns back to powder during drying. The amount of product is great for the money. It works just as expected for both my son and myself, drawing out his blackheads, and my under the skin bumps. Follow the directions using an astringent to remove the powder. We have been using this twice a week for about 3 weeks now and love the results.

I'm super picky when it comes to moisturizers - any scent is usually overpowering for me, so I am happy to report that this moisturizer doesn't really smell like anything. I'm a little confused that it has a bit of a pink hue to it - reminds me of calamine lotion a little bit :) It is SO THICK when it comes out of the bottle, it definitely sinks into the skin and provides hydration for an extended period without any greasiness. I'd definitely pick up a larger bottle in the future! This tiny one will probably be enough for the dark Settle winter, though. :|
Mom likes it.

This is a soft gemtle cream that is easily absorbed. With conscientious use it does appear to help with under-eye bags It doesn't completely eliminate them (nothing short of surgery would, I think) but it does alleviate the puffiness and reduce the redness.

I have tested it for almost a month--a month in which I was under a lot of stress due to my husband's surgeries. I haven't slept well and am run down. So, if under these circumstances, I saw a slight improvement in my under-eye area, I imagine that under normal circumstances the improvement would have been greater.

It has a slight scent that disappears after a few minutes, and is very easy to smooth on. It comes in a small opaque plastic jar with a pump that dispenses a large droplet--enough to smooth under both eyes with a bit left over to smooth under both brows. Because the jar is opaque, it's impossible to tell how much is left.

The skin around the eyes is very sensitive and I have often had allergic reactions to many creams but I had none with this one. I have used many eye creams over the years and usually find them effective IF you use them twice a day (morning and bed time). This one is no different from other more and less expensive creams: it works if you use it correctly.

So, yes, it is a good cream. It is worth trying. I plan to purchase another little jar so I can see if, under less trying conditions, the improvement is more dramatic.

I never suspected that they actually 'made' things in Monaco but, apparently they do and this men's deodorant stick comes straight out of Monaco, actually made there. And I can see how a prince, but not a princess, would want to wear it. And I can definitely see myself wearing it when out on a date or, more realistically for me, at a social function.

I am allergic to most fragrances but, to my surprise, I found myself tolerating this one quite well. The smell is subtle, not pungent, and yet pleasant in a manly way and, thanks to 'no alcohol', there shouldn't be much skin irritation. The high price is absolutely warranted in my view because of a significantly better quality product than the less expensive but much more 'strident' items one normally finds in a normal store.

There are many things to like about this serum - the lightness of the feel on the skin, the absorbency, the light aroma of orange, the vitamins A,C and E - and the inclusion of a collagen boost.  I haven't been using it long enough to expect visual results and don't know if I will see any on my 80 year old skin.  Several things are bothersome - it has a very high price compared to what appear to be so many other competitive products that promise the same results with many of the same ingredients.  The lack of packaging and instructions also makes one wonder.  At the price, one would expect to receive it boxed with explanations and instructions.  Instead, it arrives just as is, with directions that require a magnifying glass on the back.  There must be a " backstory" here that we're not privy to.  Since I like the ingredients, as far as I know them, and it does seem to make my skin softer, and I like the aroma - and it all agrees with my sensitive skin, I'll continue to use it.  If it turns out to be a miracle for 80 year-old skin, I'll amend my review right away!

works great with my natural polishes like zoya, karma etc. I used karma top coat before . this one is less expensive and a lot more shiny. it dries faster also. I am very happy with it.  if you haven't tried zoya polishes-give em a go, they are amazing. I recommend googling swatches/pics of the color you want before buying.

I've used Mario Badescu skincare products for years because of their consistently good quality.  This Vitamin E lotion hydrates quickly, is easily absorbed but doesn't leave my skin feeling greasy.  I've used it on my very dry patches and the relief was immediate.  There's a subtle scent.

starting to show more minor laxity to skin than wrinkles at 54 years of age. My love started when I  got a jumbo sample of this that lasted 2 weeks and I was very happy with it. I've spent money on everything from high end dept store moisture to not so high end and this really does the trick for me so I ordered more. I use it one time daily face and neck. I really notice about a 30% difference so far and ESPECIALLY my neck has less crepe than it did. Not all brands work the same for all people, but this works well for this 54 year old female who is starting to see the signs of mother time! I'm going to switch it up to 2 times daily. Until I read further I didn't realize it was for 2 time per day use and was only using it at night!

Reading the reviews here, I had hopes of finding a lip lacquer that would actually be long lasting, but I'm still searching. I've seen Japonesque while overseas but was hesitant to buy an unknown product. It's not bad - at least the lip lacquer. The packaging is a little on the plain side but pretty (clear tube, black top w/ decoration on the upper cap), but it doesn't seem cheap. The product is creamy and pleasant smelling, and goes on smooth. It doesn't come across as tacky once on the lip. The color (I tried 4), is a nice pinkish mauve and matched what was shown on the site. However, it lasted... well, basically as much as any other lip lacquer I've tried, some cheaper than $20.
summary: decent quality, but not that impressed

reviewText: I was looking for a relatively inexpensive soap for ever day shaves. I like to save my artisan stock for special occasions and I am not made of money ya know. As a mass produced soap it's actually really nice. It loads well, though I will say it loads better on stiffer brushes than softer ones. The scent is nice and has some staying power. The slickness is about average I would say and it provides decent cushion. Is this the best soap in the world? Nope. Is this soap a decent proformer at a great price point? Absolutely. One of the advantages of this soap over the cream in a tube is that it has a better post shave. Not sure why but it is definitely more moisturizing and has a better finish than the tube creams from Proraso. This is their sensitive skin formula (and I have some sensitive skin.) Let me just say a preshave is a must. I use an oil but you could use theirs as well.
