reviewText: I think finding the right shade of concealer or foundation online is hard.  I am not sure this is the right shade for me or my daughter, but going to give it a try.  I love the thickness of this foundation, it will definitely do the the trick to cover up blemishes or under eye circles.  If you don't like high coverage foundation, this is not for you.  If you need a highly pigmented, high coverage foundation, I recommend you try this one.  I am very happy with it, but I might need to try another shade.  I think this foundation might be enough to cover blemishes/dark circles, and might not even need concealer.  I like eliminating steps in my make up routine.

There's a difference between the Fair and Light tints on this concealer, but it's miniscule. Honestly, I think the two are misnamed. The Light tube is actually a bit darker to my eye than the Fair. See the photo.

The Fair turned out to be the right shade for me and after several days of use, I like it. I haven't had any skin irritation when using it to cover under eye circles. It doesn't cake up, but I use a very tiny amount so your mileage may vary.
summary: The Fair is a bit lighter than the Light. Works well for dark circles

reviewText: I love this face cream.  It leaves your face supple and soft, not sticky or greasy.  The sunscreen SPF 30 is a huge factor for me, and I'll be using this daily instead of my regular skin care line.
Wonderful color

This is an absolutely lovely scent. The packaging is downright goofy, with its clunky square top/bottom, though it does look kind of cool, in an odd, laboratory-ish way.

The scent, though, is really wonderful. It starts off at the light, fruity end of floral, but as it lingers you can detect a woodsiness as well as a bit of powder. Heck, I don't know what I'm talking about, but I do really like this eau de toilette spray, which lasts for hours in a pleasant way.

I would say it is appropriate for either gender.
summary: lovely scent -- floral with lingering woodsy notes

reviewText: Really meant to order same brand but at 50 spf.  I can use the lower spf during southern California winter.  Recommended by my dermatologist and was told not to go below 30 spf so I am safe.  Also seems to leave less of the yellow color on my clothing.
summary: Very good brand / recommended by my dermatologist

reviewText: I purchased this because I am loving the vinylux I get at salons, and I hope to make it last just a little longer by reapplying the top coat.  Also, I will be able to do my nails myself once I have it.  The vinylux product is great - just like polish, doesn't trash your nails like shellac, and seems to last on my nails at least a week without chipping.

This is a great item. It uses small batteries to provide a very smooth trim of your facial hair. Now, this is the thing. When I purchased another kind of trimmer it did not cut, but pinched. This item does not do that at all. It cuts like crazy and that is great because it makes it a very smooth cut. Get it and enjoy trimming your ears (and avoiding looking like an old man.)
summary: A great trimmer to avoid those old man issues

reviewText: It's an original CND Shellac product. As described.

My daughter has been using this peel.  She has no complaints about it being uncomfortable -- she says it tingles a bit.

The effects after a few uses have been noticeable.  She gets mild acne blemishes that can leave her skin tone uneven.  This peel has helped to reduce the appearance of the acne and has helped to even out her skin tone.  So the product works, as one would hope at this price.

There is plenty of product here for multiple applications, and it derives from natural sources, so you aren't getting a face full of funky chemicals.  Bottom line, this is a beauty product that delivers.

I've only been using this for about a week, nightly. It's nice, as far as it goes on smoothly and my face feels nice and soft in the morning. Time will tell if it "evens out skin tone" as I hope it does. I am very fair, not acne prone, but have sensitive skin and sun discolorations are starting to show in spots (like wide freckles). I'll update in a few months of regular use to tell if I get results with that aspect of this serum. It's pricey, so, I want it to work for that!
good

I have pale, almost non-existent eyebrows.  Currently I've been using two different department store brands of "wind up" automatic pencils.  They're smooth going on but very easily break off, and are expensive for the amount of actual product inside the pencil.  I've also tried hard pencils but they don't apply easily and often the color is too dark or doesn't show up at all.  And the brow powders I've tried are difficult to get on light enough to not look like a drawn-on eyebrow, plus powder doesn't seem to last all day or stay on when swimming.  This micro pencil is the best of all of them:  goes on easily/smoothly in tiny strokes so it looks very natural, is a great color for me, stays on until you take it off, and you get the whole pencil plus sharpener.  It will last a long time and is a good value.  I highly recommend this product--it is my new holy grail of eyebrow pencils!!
summary: Great color and coverage for me!

reviewText:
I've been using the proraso line for a while now, they pretty much only make the one cream and a couple others similar to it but yeah, I really like how it makes my face feel after a shave and also how it is so quick to lather up with even a halfway decent brush.

I like the tubes of cream more because they just seem to lather faster than most of the tubs of cream, those tend to need a little more work.

I wanted to try this primarily for the skin brightening, but also to combat fine lines. The ingredient list wasn't full of scary things so it was worth trying.

Fine lines- the acidic skin peel effect is very mild, and there hasn't been enough time to really tell if it's helping the fine lines around my mouth and eyes. The appearance of them is minimized though after application.

Skin brightening- this is more obvious. I have a largish freckle on the tip of my nose, and it is noticeably lighter. It's not gone, but I can actually camouflage it with make up now without pulling out the serious concealer.

I like how well it applies, it smooths easily, and when it's dry it's lightweight and nearly unnoticeable.
The scent for this product was overwhelming.  I gave it away.  It smells like really strong pumpkin spice.  Putting it on my face made me nauseous.

Apricot highlights with illuminations sounds all good.  Packaged in an easy-to-carry, easy-to-apply stick wherein the creamy contents ooze through a brush in just the right amount sounds better yet.  But, alas, the color of the product adds nothing save perhaps...maybe a  small amount of evenness to the skin surface coupled with a hint of luminosity.  I know these benefits with less subtlety and more satisfaction can be had in a somewhat less convenient delivery system for a lower price.
Im use to Essie polishes being of better quality. I had to put on 3 coats to get an accurate color pay off.
I thought the color would be more on the pink side, but it had a slight orange undertone at least on me which was not flattering at all.
summary: A little on the orange side

reviewText:
I've never been great about taking care of my skin, but now that I'm aging (late 50s), I am trying to be better. One troubling area is my neck.

I was a little afraid of trying this product because I've had some allergic reactions in the last year or so after trying some cosmetic products. Fortunately, this one did NOT cause any allergic reactions.

It feels pleasant when it's applied, and there's enough product to last a long time (which is good because this stuff is VERY expensive). According to the package, the ingredients include Pro-Niacin, Lipodipeptide Tensor, Algae Extract, and Sodium Hyaluronate--all of which contribute to slowing down the skin aging process--and maybe even reverse some damage.

The product definitely made my skin feel softer and tighter. Also, the next morning I thought the product made my neck look better. Maybe it's an illusion, but I definitely plan to continue to use this.
summary: Crazy Expensive But Seems To Work

reviewText: This is a wonderful color! Chalky pink that is perfect for spring or summer.  Can be used with a glitter over top for a different look.  I am planning on trying some layering with additives and colors soon to see what else this can do. All by itself it has a nice even coverage just like ALL shellac colors do!  Very pleased with this color, looks great with any skin tone!
My new favorite color; this coral is a little sparkly, but without the excessive glitter.
THE SMELL IS DELISH!  i have used the Oribe products for about a year now and will never switch.  And the SMELL!  You will fall in love with it!

style: {'Color:': ' 80W Chocolate Brown: For deep skin with warm undertones with a hint of red brown'}
reviewText: These cream is heavy, so much so that it comes with a small spatula for scraping it out of the jar. However, this strong consistency is good, because it does cover imperfections and it helps to match different skin tones, and once is applied, it doesnt look pasty. The cream must be kneaded between our fingers before applying it to our face, and it does go over it smoothly, and once its dry, it lasts all day long. I suggest finishing with a Dermablend powder of a similar shade for a flawless look.

This product arrived this afternoon. I eagerly removed it for the box and began to pump away ... totally excited to try this new serum. After many, many pumps, nothing happened. I took the top off and instantly noticed that the "straw" that connects to the pump was missing. This explains why no amount of pumping would result in any product. I found a pack of chopsticks in our junk drawer and gave the contents a little prod ... hoping to locate and reconnect that "straw" type device. There was nothing in the bottle except for the serum ... with no way to get it out. (It is so thick that my shaking it, tapping it, and even slamming it against my palm resulted in very little coming out).

From what I can deduce, the smell is REALLY nice, and it seems to have a lovely shimmer, but woe betide the person who gets a bottle similar to mine. Does it work? I have no idea. I cannot even get it out of the bottle. What a weird quality-control issue. If I can locate any way to get this out of the bottle without contaminating it, I will update this review.
Another beautiful color, I am loving this.

I don't use much make up, only lip gloss and a bit eye shadow. A makeup artist friend told me I need primer to keep shadow in place longer. This is grrrreat primer. Very light, not greasy. Goes on smooth with a bit shimmer. And it is least toxic one I could find. If you are sensitive to common makeup or can't wear much eye makeup, I'd recommend this primer for you.
Very Oily results

This cleaner works well and has a very pleasant scent.  It was able to take makeup off that I had worn ten hours.  It also did not dry out my skin.

It was, however, emailed in a bubble envelope by Amazon, which caused the dispenser to crack.  None of the product was wasted, however I was not able to use the pump, unfortunately.
summary: None of the product was wasted, however I was not able to use the ...

reviewText: This really does disguise thinning hair.  I am a female with thin hair due to medication.  this keeps my part from looking too wide.  Looks normal/natural.

I have been using this for about 5 days straight and I have really noticed a difference in the dry skin on my feet.  The mud goes on thick, as you would expect, with just a slight scent.  It dries fairly fast so you can put socks on or start walking without too much delay.  It really seems to penetrate into the soles of the foot leaving the foot smoother and more moisturized for 24 hours or so.  I am really going to enjoy this thru the winter when everything gets dried out by the heater.
summary: Moisturizing and smoothing mud cream for feet

reviewText: I love this bright, coral color. It is the perfect start to spring or summer and CND has the best shellac.
good product

Here is my honest review of this product:

Pros: My skin looks better! My pores look smaller and overall my skins appearance is better, including the control of minor acne breakouts

Cons: This is not a "slight tingly sensation", it is almost a intolerable burning effect. Do Not get it near your eyes because it will also feel like burning. After 5-10 minutes, the intense and uncomfortable burning goes away. It smells like alcohol/astringent, strong toner. Product design: The serum dropper feels larger that it should be, I would've preferred a small dropper and it sometimes leaks when you screw the top back on which wastes product.

Overall, I would not choose to use this product again. Even if my skin looks better, I cant use it everyday and only switch off with my other serums because of the uncomfortable sensation.

NOTE: This review is for the BURBERRY Body Tender, Eau de Toilette, NOT THE BODY MILK. Amazon inadvertently sent us the perfume to review instead of the milk, and as my girlfriend (and me) really like the fragrance we decided to keep it.

This product has been a refreshing change. Due to having migraines, asthma, and a VERY sensitive nose, my girlfriend is generally unable to wear most scents. With the BURBERRY Body Tender, Eau de Toilette, however, she found she could apply small amounts of it to places generally not near her face (on the small of her back, I believe), and it didn't cause any reaction.  She's pleased because she LOVES the Burberry fragrance and says it make her feel "sexy". I wholeheartedly agree with her assessment!

It has a subtle citrusy, floral scent that smells clean and fresh. Over time it seems to smell more like sandalwood and musk, but never too heavy. The scent lasts much of the day, though she says she will occasionally apply a bit more in the evening if we're going out.

The fragrance comes in an interesting, tall, narrow, octagonal pink/mauve box, and the bottle within is heavy glass in the same narrow octagonal design, with a silver cap. It looks very classy on a dressing table.

Overall a great, high quality fragrance from a premium brand, with the commensurate premium price, which is the only thing I'm critical of. It's Made in France, BTW.

**** RECOMMENDED! - 4 STAR ****
summary: Has a subtle scent that is pleasant and not overpowering.

reviewText: This is gong to be a rather subjective review. When it comes to fragrances people either tend to like them or hate them. That's what this fragrance is like. It's a bit strong so if you don't like strong fragrances you're not going to like this. On the other hand, if you like stronger, uplifting fragrances this is perfect. It almost smells as if it has a hint of cinnamon and other spices and an apple undertone. That's just me. Any fragrance you use on your hair or body is going to interact with your own chemistry and you'll either love the smell or hate it. In my opinion, this is a great scent for those frumpy, tired days when you need an uplifting fragrance to enhance your mood and make you smell good. I especially like it after being around someone who has been smoking or other odors that tend to stick to your hair, clothes, and skin. This takes care of the lingering odor right away. Also, a little goes a long way with this product. One or two spritzes and you're done. Don't overdo it or you'll be regretting it for hours as the fragrance lasts quite a while.
summary: Wonderful, Uplifting Body and Hair Spray But Not for Everyone

reviewText:
I was looking forward to using this product.  I am 52 and Caucasian, but I still breakout once a month.  I was also sick over the holiday and my skin was dry.  I was drinking a lot water and moisturizing regularly and I still had a bad reaction to the cream.

First, for $80 bucks, youd think the person boxing the product would make sure there was a straw in the box.  The top of the bottle has to be removed and replaced with a pump with straw.  I double-checked the envelop, the box, and my kitchen and bathroom floors; no straw.  I took the bottle and got some in my palm.

I was planning to put it on a few minutes before my shower and let the benzoyl peroxide kill germs in my problem areas and rinse off, as not to dry out my face.  Oh no.  It burned.  I quickly got undressed and jumped in the shower and rinsed it off.  Even after I got out of the tub, my skin was still irritated.  I had to cool it off will some cooling face cream.

This whole experience did surprise me because I have been using 10% benzoyl peroxide for years.  This was only 5%.  Very disappointed.
summary: On top of no straw, it then burned my face.

reviewText: For a few more dollars I could've gotten a much BIGGER bottle!!!!!!!! Content amount is Not worth it!!!!!!!!!!!! It's a rip off
summary: People Beware: Pay attention to ALL info, this item should be labeled as MINIATURE travel size

reviewText: Good basic moisturizer. Not heavy or greasy.

style: {'Color:': ' 30N Sand: For light skin with a neutral undertones'}
reviewText:
I am new to using the Dermablend brand, but I have found that I really like it.  This is an ideal product if you are looking for full coverage.  I have some dark under eye circles and this make up did the trick.  I did not find the product irritating at all and really like the way this is packaged.  The stick is easy to use and a convenient size.
I do recommend using your finger to apply because it is easier to control the amount of product, if you just use the stick to apply directly under eye it is a little heavy.  I have used some powder to set it. The product blends easily and stays put all day.
I have not tried this to cover tattoos or bruises, but I'm sure that this could provide good coverage for those uses.
summary: This is an ideal product if you are looking for full coverage

reviewText: Love this stuff. Works like a charm. Mario Badescu has some great products and I love the drying lotion. I have cystic acne that never goes away and this takes care of it. I've tried Proactive, Actutane and loads of other things that couldn't touch it, but this really works. Plus I have sensitive skin and this doesn't bother it at all.

Great! Works perfectly at removing eye makeup without leaving a greasy residue at all. Other eye makeup removers I have used work well at removal, but left a greasy residue that made makeup application challenging the next day. This one did not do that at all. Nice product!
summary: Great! Works perfectly at removing eye makeup without leaving ...

reviewText: Super. Five stars
Product works!
worth the price
Nice quality skin care. It goes on smoothly and feels good on the skin. For a non-prescription retinol product it works very well. I have had no issues with breakouts etc
I am in love with these 20% glycolic pads. my skin is already looking clear and they use it with the skin lightener which makes it even better
summary: these glycolic passive ads are amazing pair them with a skin lightener for best results

reviewText: I ordered this because I thought it would help with the little tiny wrinkles I have around my eyes and forehead. I don't use it nearly as much as I'm supposed to, but I have noticed a difference in the smoothness of my skin. I think the little wrinkles are completely gone. Other people have noticed the difference in my face as well. I keep being told that I look healthier. Now I haven't done anything else different except to use this machine, so I know this is what they are talking about. I haven't had any of the other complaints that people have posted on their reviews about losing suction or bands breaking, so far so good. I will update if any of that happens. As of right now, I am pretty happy with this little device, I look healthier, and feel better about myself already.
summary: I'm pretty pleased with this product so far

reviewText:
Before getting this gift set, I'd never heard of the bliss brand before. After using these products for a month, I'm impressed ... for the most part. First, I should say that I have pretty good skin--I don't really get acne anymore, and my face tends more toward dry than oily. I'm also not sensitive or allergic to any products that I know of.

*Lemon-Sage Body Butter: I absolutely love the smell of this body butter! I also appreciate that it leaves my skin hydrated without feeling greasy. It's not as thick as some other body butters, so it doesn't just sit on top of the skin--it absorbs very easily. I get very dry legs during the winter, and this body butter has gone a long way toward softening my skin and reducing that dry skin itchiness.

*Fabulous Foaming Face Wash: I've been using this every day for nearly a month, and I like it. It doesn't dry out my skin at all, and a little bit goes a long way--I still have about 1/2 of the bottle left.

*Triple Oxygen Instant Energizing Mask: I love this mask! I just love the way it feels on my face with the bubbling :-) I don't know that it's doing much, but I love the feel!

*The LoveHandler: Honestly, this product strikes me as completely ridiculous. I don't believe for an instant that it's going to reduce my love handles. I wish that another face product or lotion had been included in this set instead.

The set is packaged nicely and would make a good gift for the bliss fan in your life. For myself, though, I'll stick with cheaper products that work just as well.

At 42, I'm a bit younger than the target market for this product, but I love skincare products and L'Occitane, and so eagerly picked this up as part of the Vine program.  I've been using it now for about a month (I wanted to give it time to work), and am impressed with how lovely this makes my skin.

When you first open the box it comes in, be sure to check the corner of the box for the small application spatula that is tucked away in a fold of the corner.  The spatula makes for a more hygienic application since you don't have to dip your fingers into the jar and risk the possibility of introducing bacteria into the cream.  (Of course, Paula Begoun mentions that skin creams and lotions should really be in tubes so that the product ingredients don't oxygenate and lose their potency; the spatula doesn't help avoid that issue, but at least it makes things more sanitary.)

Because this cream is thick and because I use a lotion with SPF during the day, I've only been using this at night.  I spread it on over my Retin-A, and it helps keep my skin supple and moist.  I don't think that it has made my fine lines any less noticeable, but it helps alleviate the dryness and peeling that my Retin-A sometimes leaves in its wake.

I have sensitive, oily skin, and appreciate that this is also non-comodogenic, so it won't clog pores or cause pimples.

It's a lovely luxury product that makes your skin feel silky smooth!
summary: Very rich cream that softens the skin

reviewText:
I know many people don't get the purpose of thermal water, especially the Evian thermal spray. People tend to associate Evian only with drinking water, and find this aerosol to be no more than a gimmick.
Thermal water works wonders to balance the Ph of the skin, especially for sensitive skin. It can also be used to refresh the skin throughout the day. Some even use it to set their makeup because of the fine, even mist.
I keep mine in the refrigerator and use it first thing in the morning after washing my face. My son has very dry skin, he suffers from eczema, and loves to use it every few hours to add a bit of moisture and refresh the skin.
Ive tried several types of thermal water- Vichy, La Roche Posay, Avene- and the Evian is hands down my favorite; Ive been using it for about 8 years now. Its mostly due to the fact that Evians spray nozzle sprays evenly and is the most consistent, bottle after bottle.
The results from the other brands are practically identical, at least when it comes to its effect on the skin, but Evian is just more dependable. Theres no leaking from the nozzle, no uneven spraying, no clogs, and all the water gets used up.
If your skin is missing a touch of moisture, dewiness, need a new toner, or a way to refresh your skin with or without makeup, give this a try!
summary: Great Toner & Refreshing Mist for Every Skin Type

reviewText: Nice eye cream. It was silky to put on. A little goes a very long way. It was soothing to my eyes and REDUCED the puffiness.

I liked this concealer but not as well as the one I was currently using. This one is extremely sheer which is good on most areas especially on age 50 plus skin and it does not look heavy or leave your more wrinkled areas more noticeable. I always mist with witch hazel then use my sunscreen moisturizer with a drop of Moroccan oil and then concealer before using a highlighter. This has a nice moist consistancy on it's own and goes on very silky with the excellent applicator which I really liked. The medium is lighter then most other mediums I have used, almost too light for me but not bad, I would have liked it a touch darker and I am somewhat fair to med..The reason I like my Benefit brand Boing medium concealer better, it covers way better if you have scars to cover, this one was too sheer for those areas and did not cover as well. Benefit Boing also covers dark circles much better then this product. For half the cost I will stay with Benefit brand but this was a close second just not as good for my particular needs.
summary: Good but not my favorite for dark circles and scars

reviewText: Luv this brand.
Some good classic Sandalwood with long lasting protection and use.

About 20 years ago (ugh feeling old), this was THE perfume/cologne that the cool kids wore. I decided recently that it still smells pretty darn good and wanted to go retro like the secret hipster that I am. Everyone in their 30s & 40s recognizes the scent even if they don't know exactly that it's CK1. My only complaint is that it can give me a headache. Worth it.

I do not know about the rest of the universe, but I like having soft skin. I like when people tell me its touchable. L'Occitane Almond Supple Skin Oil takes my soft skin and turns it into a velvety epidermis of silk.

I love the way it smells, like almonds but more like untamed forests of almonds. Its earthy and sweet. not overpowering and definitely not perfume-y.
It soaks in so fast, I loved rubbing it into every curve and crevice. I did not use it on my face too much because I am super sensitive but I did try it out as a makeup remover and it was magnificent, no problems what so ever. It also did not irritate my skin anywhere.

It is supposed to firm up your flesh, I did not find that happening. I was happy enough that it made me feel like a queen.

I have a fine hair, bleached and this product is perfect for me. Looks like after a month after getting highlights my hair becomes dull a bit darker and this mousse makes them look fresher.
Also it gives nice volume which is always needed for me.
Great product.

I actually really like this product very much.

Yes, it does seem strange to buy an aerosol can of water, but this is pH balanced at 7.0, and has no SD alcohol, witch hazel, fragrance, or other irritating ingredients.

But how is it different from tap water, assuming yours is also at pH 7 level?  It's in the delivery.  This dispenses (for a while) a very fine mist of water continuously.  It dispenses extremely fine water droplets very gently.  I've tried using plastic bottles, but can never get them to dispense so effectively.  It's very nice to use just before applying moisturizer.  I can (well, could) get a very fine layer of water on my skin, which makes it easier to apply moisturizer, and use less as well, offsetting the cost of this product.

I was in love until I got halfway through the can.  I always keep it capped, but the nozzle is clogged.  I've wiped it dry, tried shaking the can, wiped it dry again, but it keeps clogging.  This make it dispense unevenly.  Sometimes just a little water comes out, then it spurts.  This I find very disappointing, because it's difficult to find any product resembling a toner that doesn't have noxious ingredients.

This cream goes on thicker than the creams I am used to, but it really does seem to protect and moisten skin during this harshly dry, cold winter.

I use it at night to help hydrate my very dry skin and I definitely think it is helping.

I have less flaking and redness in using it.

This cleansing gel gives me that enzyme exfoliation that my skin needs without irritating my sensitive skin. It has a light, fresh scent and great consistency.

Plus, the bottle is huge. A little goes a long way and I only have to buy it twice a year.
summary: fresh scent and great consistency. Plus

reviewText:
On the whole, being born blonde is a fabulous blessing.  My only teensy, tiny, wee complaint is that I have super light eyebrows that literally disappear when I have my picture taken with a flash.  It's creepy, actually.  They're super pale - I am talking Casper pale.

I have used Sephora's Eyebrow Kit (which comes with stencils and two blendable shades) which I love, but this pencil is easier to use and more portable.

Bonus:  Strawberry blondes will be able to use this pencil as it has a very slight reddish tint.

I am on a constant quest to find a good night cream for my dry skin.  As I have gotten older, my skin has become drier.  The challenge has been to find a skin cream that moisturizes deeply without being greasy.  Well, I am happy to report that this skin cream does just that.

Why I love this product:

* The heavenly texture. It is described as gel, but it is really more of a cream.  I guess thats why the word balm is in the name.  It just glides onto my skin.

* It works.  My skin feels moisturized, yet not greasy.  Even in the winter, when my skin is especially dry, it works.

* The pretty pink color.  The balm is a light pink, and its quite pleasing to the eye.  This really has nothing to do with how well it works, but it is a pleasure to put on this balm.

* The light, pleasing scent.  I have been disappointed with so many skin creams because of their heavy, artificial scent.  I never considered myself all that sensitive to scents until I started trying some of the other creams.

* The detailed picture inside of the box that shows the best way to apply this cream.  Who knew there was an art to this?

If you are looking for a nice skin cream that works to moisturize, you will enjoy this product.

This polish is awesome.  It does not chip or crack, and the color stays on for a long time.
I have purchased more colors!

I have been using the NuFace since December it is now March. I started out using it across my whole face but it made the muscles around my eyes twitch so I changed to using only on the lower half. I wanted to see it lift the jowls that have started to sag and remove the smile wrinkle that is by the side of my mouth. I use this 2-3 times a week and do the extra moves for tightening. I have not seen any change unfortunately. You get 5 face cleaners that have a soft side and a bumpy side. I went through them within a week. The gel feels like a nice hydration that you leave on your face after your session is over. The lifting gel I only use at night because it dries like a glue holding your face in shape but it glossy and visible. The mister is nice, especially through winter and smells pleasant.  One bonus for me is while running this along my cheeks and jaw bone it stimulates my saliva glands which for me is a good thing as I suffer from dry mouth. I will probably continue to use it for that reason alone. While stimulating I get a metallic taste in my mouth. It might prove to be a good preventative for skin yet for my middle aged face that has started to droop it has not made an improvement yet. I was able to use it at the 4 setting, be sure to have your skin covered in the gel or you will feel the tingling current especially by the ears as you pull back across the cheeks.
summary: Good hydration, stimulates saliva glands, yet no toning for my middle aged skin.

reviewText: Fabulous hair dryer. Really fabulous. Dries quickly, even with my long hair doesn't overheat and still leaves it shiny. I've had probably 5 hair dryers in 5 years and this is by far the best.
summary: I've had probably 5 hair dryers in 5 years and this is by far the best.

reviewText: I start my daily Revision facial regime with this facial wash.  A little dot goes a long way.  Produces a light foam to clean face.  Follow with other Revision products.

For some reason when i put this nail polish on it goes on with a matte finish and looks weird. I feel like when i bought it that it had been tampered with before. None of my other essie colors that i've bought from a store has done that.
summary: I feel like when i bought it that it had been tampered ...

reviewText: First of all, let me say that Proraso is good quality stuff.  I gave this 3 stars because IMHO, it doesn't work as well as the shave creams that come in the tubes.  I have a tube of Proraso, but wanted to try this, and the razor glides much better with the cream and I get a much better shave.  Also, from reading all the reviews and tips on how to use this soap, a lot of users are saying to swirl the brush directly in the container to start a lather, and then transfer to another bowl to complete the lather.  I did this and it does work well, but that makes it a 2-step process which I don't want to do.  I'd rather squeeze cream out of a tube directly on the brush, then do the lather in a shaving bowl.  And for those asking if this is a hard puck or a cream, it's kind of in-between.  It's not as hard as a traditional bar of soap, but it's definitely not a cream.  It's definitely solid enough that you can take the product out of the bowl and hold it in your hand, put it back in the bowl, and you wouldn't need to wipe any residue off your hand.
summary: The cream in the tubes has done much better for me.

reviewText: This helped a bit with breakouts but not as much as I was hoping. It did make my skin feel super smooth. Worth trying for the price though! It's a little hard to use - some people use a cotton ball but what I found most effective was wetting my Beauty Blender, dipping it into the powder, then dabbing onto my face. Worked like a charm!
summary: It did make my skin feel super smooth. Worth trying for the price though

reviewText: I am sensitive to smells and this fortunately has no cloying or otherwise unpleasant odor.  It is soft and gentle and provides protection from body odor.
Watery and green is a neon green. Unlike pic.
Great product for skin

I'm not sure how much I can say about a candle but I have sure enjoyed this one. Its price may not warm the cockles of your heart but the candle has a lot to commend it. The fragrance is fresh and classy rather than sickeningly sweet like many candles. The wick holds up nicely. The candle burns completely evenly as is the quality of a good soy candle. When the candle is blown out, the containing glass that holds it does not stay hot. In fact, the glass container does not get overly hot even when the candle is burning which is a big plus for those concerned with fire hazards. This candle makes a great addition to a romantic evening.
My favorite sunscreen! Goes on very light and even.  I use this for biking and jogging outside.  Not sure how it would be in the water. This is my second order.
Powder color is off, much lighter than expected, not the same as I have gotten before but should be. Can not compare to Bare Minerals.

Love this lip balm. I usually buy multiples at a time to have one in my purse,one at the office, by nightstand, etc... you get the ideal. I don't find myself reapplying too often with these so they tend to last longer as well.

I have to give them credit for keeping this very light. It's a nice somewhat flowery scent that isn't overbearing. Definitely has the potential to make a nice gift. I also like that they didn't go too far overboard with the design of the bottle. It looks good in a confident way, rather than some of the really over-the-top bottles I've seen for perfume that left me wondering how much of the money was just going to cover the bottle and convince me it was something I wanted to look at on a dresser.
summary: It's a nice somewhat flowery scent that isn't overbearing

reviewText: Great moisturizer! You do not need a large amount of the product to cover the entire face. Mario got this one right. After application, my face feels smooth and never flakes or gets dry!

Nia 24 Sun Damage Prevention 100% Mineral Sunscreen SPF 30, 2.5 fl. oz. works well for me but I do have to mention a few negatives. First the price is a bit high. As well as it works, the price is a bit much. Also, the zinc will leave you with a white face if you are not careful about how much you apply. Start off with a small amount and rub it in well. You do not need a lot. It is very easy to overcoat and this not only leaves you with a white clown face, but it can irritate your skin. With this product less is more. It works really well so over applying is too simple. And that leaves you looking odd and feeling uncomfortable. Used is the 'less is more' style you get the full benefits with none of the negatives.

Nia 24 Sun Damage Prevention 100% Mineral Sunscreen SPF 30, 2.5 fl. oz.is reccomended. I am pleased with it, but be careful as to the application. This is a very good product that you have to pay attention to how it is used.

This is a very good pencil liner.  It is retractable, no need to sharpen.  I do find the tip gets a bit rounded, so like most other pencil liners, you really aren't going to get the most precise thin line.  But I tend to smudge my liner anyway.  The shade of black is nice and dark, although not quite as dark as Urban Decay Blackout if you are familiar with that shade.  It is closer in color to Urban Decay Zero (which I prefer, but not everyone does).  I find that this stays on really well.  I don't really use it on my waterline, just smudged on my lid, but it stays well and smokes out well with a brush.  The pencil has a smudger sponge, but I don't find the smudger all that useful.  It kind of tugs on the lid, so I prefer to use a brush to smoke it out.  Overall, this is a good liner.  I have it in 2 other shades as well (chocolate and bronze).  I like it just as much as my Urban Decay 24/7 liners but appreciate that I don't have to sharpen them.
summary: This is a very good pencil liner

reviewText: Dries my skin out really bad
summary: Not good for the price. Higher expectations

reviewText: I loved the color.  But this entire color line by Essie chips VERY FAST.  Even with a great top coat.  Fortunately it dries fast.  But I found myself having to redo my nails almost every day with all of the colors that I bought from this line.  Making me shy away from Essie for a while...

I've heard such great things about this product for such a long time and I finally decided to give it a try a few weeks ago. I am so impressed with how fast it works and I love that the ingredients list is very minimal. Visit my blog at christinaschiccorner.com to read my full, more detailed review I posted about it.

style: {'Color:': ' 40N Bronze: For medium to tan skin with neutral undertones'}
reviewText:
I live in Florida and now that I'm retired, I don't wear make-up much anymore.  I have very fair skin with some blotches and imperfections.  There are times that I want to have a little bit of coverage to help even out my skin.  I actually used this product on my face to set foundation and found it to be very nice.

I have never had any training on how to use make-up properly.  I truly love the Internet because you can search anything and find clear instructions and videos.  Even on the Dermablend Website, you will find some useful tips and clear instructions.  You can even go to a department store that sells this brand for some guidance, proper methods of applying, and what color combination is best for your skin.
This is a very good brand of gel. I recently bought this whole line, my clients are very happy with the outcome of their nails!
This CND shellac is very durable and stays on without chipping until my nails grow out and I have to remove it myself.
summary: Once you Shellac, you never go back!

reviewText: Good color but more pink than I would have liked. Very pearly light pink. Still wore it and it was fine.
AAA+++
Loveliest color I've ever owned!
Love Essie but i am not thrilled about this color but too each his own..

I'm not the best person to review this because I haven't tried all others--I have used different creams that serve as wrinkle reducers around the eyes, but I haven't used them religiously and I don't really have significant wrinkles to begin with, so I've had trouble deciding how well the items work.  This doesn't make things worse, but I can't see that it makes things better.  It comes out as this little white creme and a little goes a long way.  It is absorbed into the skin and appears to be working.  I just can't say for sure that it has erased wrinkles.  In terms of ease of use, I find the pump okay--I  dabbed the item into a finger and applied it directly like that.
Beautiful color!  Great quality nail polish, and received very quickly

I've used this creme a few times and have seen noticeable improvement in my skin's texture and color. Dry patches are moisturized and damaged areas have reduced color.

A tiny dab goes a long way, so even though the price is quite high, you'll have the creme for a long time.

I was worried that this would feel uncomfortable while sleeping. It doesn't. What is bothersome is the scent. It's perfumed and it's not my favorite. Having a smell you don't love slathered all over your face for the night is inescapable. That said, the benefits out weigh the cost in this case.

style: {'Style:': ' Tint Broad Spectrum SPF 50 Warm Sunscreen'}
reviewText: When getting this product, I couldn't tell whether my skin tone would be a "cool" or a "warm" tint because I have Asian skin. It would have been preferable if the product site had shown some color samples on what type of skin type you were. For myself, the "cool" tint worked better, despite this "warm" tint being pretty sheer. Overall, it's a good product if you can get the correct tint for your skin. It doesn't smell strongly of sun screen and it feels reasonably light on the skin.
summary: the "cool" tint worked better, despite this "warm" tint being pretty sheer

reviewText: Pretty color and much to m surprise it stayed on really well - in fact it was harder to get off than regular nail polish.  Bright and pretty.

The first thing to know is that this product doesn't have what I would characterize as a "spicy citrus" fragrance, as advertised. It has a very pleasant mild scent, more woody than citrus.  Although this is marketed for men, I think it works well for both men and women, as the fragrance isn't overtly masculine or feminine. The texture is very silky and rinses cleanly; it is a pleasure to use. My husband loves being able to use one product as both shower gel and shampoo, and it works well for him, but I suspect most women would prefer to use this as a shower gel while continuing to use regular shampoo (I do).
summary: Smells great while keeping it simple

reviewText: I'd been dying for this color from the day I saw it on the Essie site, and for anyone who's been on there you'll know it's been sold out for months! Finally I found it on Amazon and I nearly cried. It's the most perfect pink and definitely a must have nail polish color. No matter the season, hot pink is always in style, and it's absolutely perfect for nights out! It makes me feel ten times hotter when I'm shaking it in the club and my glowing pink tipped nails catch the flashing lights. Definitely buy this color!!! You need it I swear.

My brother loves Baxter of California.  These three piece together make for a great value!

Pros:
-The face wash lathers well and leaves your face feeling clean and smooth!
-The toner is the best item in this trio, according to my brother!
-The toner has a light fragrance to it, but the moisturizer and face wash are fragrance free.
-Most importantly, this is a great deal.  All together, this is a pretty awesome gift set.
-There seems to be a noticeable difference in my brothers skin since beginning this Baxter of California 1.2.3 Skin kit.

Overall, my bother loves this set and when I asked about cons, he had none.  Myself, I do think the containers need a bit of sprucing up-- they're so simple.  However, for him, It was a perfect gift set and that isn't heard very often!
Good to moisturize the area

My hair is dyed blonde and has been looking a bit over processed, dry and the color could be a bit shinier.

I used the product as advertised and have to say first of all, it lathers up nicely and has a pleasant, light scent.  It took a few times of using it, but I noticed after awhile, my hair started looking fresher and shinier and not as dry and over processed. I have not tried the conditioner with it, but definitely notice a difference just from the shampoo and hope to see continuing improvement.

Im completely obsessed with this dry shampoo! I've tried so many and this has just taken over my #1 spot (my old favorite was The Dry Bar dry shampoo... but this one wins with the smell). The smell of this is amazing- fruity but not terribly overpowering. It smells the best of any dry shampoo I've used. I have blonde hair so I might not be the best judge for all hair colors, but I find that this is not at all chalky and blends in really well. It does give me a little extra volume too. I can get 3-4 days out of this. Will be repurchasing!
This stuff is a miracle in a jar. It's a bit heavy for my skin every night but it works wonders when I get dry patches or need my skin to look dewy the next day.
summary: This stuff is a miracle in a jar. It's ...

reviewText: I love the shellacs, the thing that always bothered me is the lack of selection for colors, I'm so glad to see new colors coming out more often and such beautiful ones at that!!!

I have wavy hair, bordering on curly, and I have two choices when it comes to styling:  enhance/embrace the curliness or try to style it into something straighter.  Lately, I've been going with the curlier look because it's getting more difficult to make my hair do what I want.  Enter this Obliphica curl control cream.  I disperse one pump throughout my hair (more on that later), and my hair is much more manageable and style-able.  The style holds throughout the day without any crunchiness or unsightly residue.  And I love the scent.

When I apply, I follow what my stylist does:  squirt a pump into my palm, pick up a bit with the fingertips from the other hand, rub it between them, and then apply by plucking two-thirds of the way up my hair to the ends.  When the cream is almost gone from my palm, I rub my two hands together and use what's on them to finish up.  I don't need to use more than that, although you may, especially if you have tightly curled hair.

I find that this curl control cream is best for, yes, controlling.  If I want to stay curly, it ends up relaxing the curls or weighing them down instead.  That's probably because I have that in-between kind of hair, neither straight nor truly curly.  It keeps the frizz under control, too.

When I use this cream and style with a brush and hair dryer, my hair keeps its body without fizz or unruliness.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

Can't give a long term review because after one use, I have decided I will not be using more of it. I have sensitive dry skin. I had tried this brand's serum and figured why not? I don't have many signs of wrinkles yet but do have a few old acne scars, so a "filling" cream is something I'm willing to try even if that sounds like an unbelievable claim -- even if it benefits my skin in any way, it'd be worth trying. I'd only try one other product that claimed to have any filling benefit (L'Oréal Paris Revitalift Volume Filler Daily Volumizing Moisturizer, 1.7 Ounce) and it was at least a good moisturizer. This filler, however, not only didn't have any "filler" benefit but also left my skin angry. At first it did feel like there was something to it... Run my hand over my face and it felt pretty smooth. Felt tight. That's always a good feature from anything you're putting on your face. Within minutes it felt dry and itchy. May be for some people but for me? Something in it is not agreeing with my skin. Any benefit that it might offer isn't worth the reaction I had to it. There's no ingredient list on the bottle, so I searched them out... not sure what is bothering my skin, but something is. Did not have this reaction with their serum so it's definitely something in this product and not necessarily in all of their product line. Water (Aqua), Glycerin, Isopentyldiol, Dimethicone, Cucumis Melo (Melon) Fruit Extract, Orchid Leaf/Root/Stem Extract, Methylglucoside Phosphate, Copper Lysinate/Prolinate, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydrogenated Vegetable Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Stearyl Alcohol, Phytosterols, Glyceryl Stearate, Polyglyceryl-10 Myristate, Tocopherol, Behenyl Alcohol, Batyl Alcohol, Polyacrylamide, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, C13-14 Isoparaffin, Laureth-7, Sodium Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol, Fragrance (Parfum).

I love this stuff, I use it tat night after I have used  my shower face brush. The skin on my face arms and hands is much better in a week. My hands were looking very worn, now they look nice and feel smooth.
I love this soap. Very gentle for sensitive skin.

This product was nothing special for me and it certainly isn't the Anti-Wrinkle Treatment miracle!  I think the powder form seems to almost accentuate the wrinkles!  It also claims that it is foundation, well it isn't in my book!  Foundation for me covers blemishes or sun spots...not this stuff!  It is also difficult to apply as it comes with no brush.  I'm not a make-up girl...I've never had formal lessons on colors or make-up trends, but this is just an extra expense with no outcome to show for it.  Another negative is that it is so messy!  I used a brush to apply this and by the time I was done, it was all over the counter!

All in all, it is just another Anti-Fatigue, Anti-Wrinkle treatment that promises results, but fails to deliver.
Best facial sunscreen EVER! It is the only one I will use!!
Been using Proraso shaving soaps for many years.  Still - very good product.
I bought this sunscreen for vacation.  It wear well under makeup and is easy to apply.  I feel the protection was adequate for my needs.
I get lots of compliments when I wear this shade.  Very elegant for a night out, and I liked using it as a base, and applying a lighter/brighter pink to my tips for a reverse French/ombre effect.

I was very excited to try this.  I've long wanted to try the Shu Uemura or Rodin facial cleansing oils, but they're just so darned expensive.  In recent years, the market seems to have been flooded with similar products at all price points but, with the exception of several free samples from the Japanese company DHC, I've still never bothered to pick one up.  I usually remove my eye make-up with Cetaphil and cleanse the rest of my face with an exfoliating product, so I've never felt the urge to stray from what works for me.  But since this was being offered as a free trial, I figured why not?

When it arrived, I immediately opened it and squirted a bit on my fingers.  My first impression was that it reminded me a bit of baby oil - the fragrance and consistency.  Very different than the DHC oil which was light and almost odorless.  Not off to a good start.  However, once activated with water the oil easily emulsified into a thin, slippery fluid and created a low grade lather that felt nice and rinsed easily.  My skin felt smooth, firm and moisturized afterward.  I was sold.

But the story doesn't end there.

After two days use, I noticed a number of clogged pores and two blemishes.  Now, I haven't had a blemish in years.  Years and years and years.  I honestly thought that any concern over zits was well behind me at this point, but I suppose I've just been using the right cosmetics and treatment products.  I tried the oil for one more night before finally calling it quits.  This seems like a high quality item and it may work for some, but I'm too old to be dealing with breakouts.

This is the best foundation I  have ever used.  I spent hundreds of dollars trying different brands of foundation, trying to find one that had excellent coverage, but was not too thick and pore clogging.  I was finally lucky enough to hear about this one.  It is just wonderful.  It is silky on your skin and provides excellent coverage.  As a bonus, since I started using it, my skin looks better and I have almost no trouble with break outs anymore.  Worth every penny!

I've never tried Ahava products because of the price, but my skin has been so dry lately that I needed something more moisturizing than what I've been using.  The reviews of this encouraged me to buy it -- and I love it! It has a lovely clean scent to it, and it's very moisturizing, without being too tacky or thick.  I always prefer hand lotions that sink in so that I don't have to wait before using the computer, and this does that really nicely.  It also helped clear up some red patches on my hands.

It's a great luxury item!
summary: Really as excellent as the reviews suggest!

reviewText: I am really enjoying the items I've purchased from La Roche-Posay. This cleanser does its job just fine; I just seem to prefer the "cream" version of this cleanser rather than the gel. That's just personal preference. I think they both work the same, though. The cream (obviously) is a bit thicker and easier to handle than the gel is.

Getting out of the shower we thought we were clean but not avoiding to the cotton ball after using this! It goes on and feels fresh and clean. It's not sticky. After it dried my face didn't feel tight - so it didn't dry out my skin. A slight clean smell, not alcohol smelling. I'm very happy with this!
Boyfriend loved it. I love it. He smells great. Can't keep my hands off him.

Love this butter London Iconoclast Mega Volume mascara. The issue I've always had with mascara is that I can feel it on my lashes. This is so lightweight that I can't tell it's there and I love that. The wand is a little strange and takes some getting used to but the mascara is lovely. The price is a little higher for the amount that you get compared to other brands I usually purchase (Too Faced, Tarte).

Nothing works better on rough heals. Put a small amount it on heals, cover with socks, wear overnight. If you do for a few nights in a row, heals will be soft. You have to be careful not to get it on tender parts of foot. It will irritate and burn any area the does not have calluses. I've never used it on elbows so can't speak to that.
Great coverage, great smooth texture and non-irritating.
Pricier facial cleanser, but the wife likes it, no allergic reaction.

My hair has the tendency to get a bit clumpy at times and hard to comb, so I decided to give this Silk Infusion from CHI product a try. I followed the directions and only applied a small amount of the product and continued styling. The results were immediate as combing my hair was a much more enjoyable experience without all of the bunching. My hair felt extremely smooth and soft and had a certain shine to it that I haven't experienced using other hair treatment products. Don't let the price detract you from giving this a try. It doesn't take a lot of this product to make your hair softer and smoother so a bottle will last you for quite a long time.
Love this gray! Asphalt is nice and dark, but tends to be very thick. Cityscape is ber smooth.  goes wonderful with metallic additives

A bit on the watery side. It took a lot of shaking of the bottle to try to mix the liquid inside, but it still came out watery. The cream kept separating and didn't blend well. I've never experienced a sunscreen lotion that was so liquid like and looked really unattractive the way it kept separating.
summary: I've never experienced a sunscreen lotion that was so liquid like and looked really unattractive the way it kept separating

reviewText:
I have coarse, curly hair and this isn't really making it sleek or manageable; it's making it wispy. I've tried using it was damp hair and dry hair. Another reviewer compared it to baby oil, and that seems exactly right. You could probably buy a bottle of baby oil for $2.00 and get the same results. Initially, it gives my hair a nice sheen, and within 20 minutes or so it's as if I'd used no product at all (i.e., the sheen is gone) and my hair has become flyaway and wispy.

Unlike some reviewers, I had no trouble with the pump. Also, the smell is pleasant---it's just not helping my hair in any way. I received this product for free in exchange for a review, but I would not pay money to replace this down the road.
summary: Makes my course, curly hair wispy. Seems like pricey baby oil.

reviewText:
Let me start by saying I am a big fan of butter LONDON products and have been for a long time. Everything blends so well (I have fair skin that can look clownish easily) and never causes breakouts on my sensitive skin.

This is a GREAT bronzer. When I ordered it, I didn't realize it was really targeted to contouring, but it didn't make a difference. I've now used it as both... a light natural bronzer just dusted on my cheeks and forehead, and for more dramatic contouring.

It comes with three shades of bronzer. The one with the most gold (far left) is the only one with shimmer, in case you are trying to avoid that for daytime or winter use. The bottom stick that looks like an applicator is actually a highlighting stick. It works best on my browbones... the yellow tone doesn't quite match my undertones enough to use it on my nose, even though I'm a neutral.

Kardashian fans take note... this is not dark enough to give you tiger stripes. Which is just fine by me. It's natural and would work for probably my tone (quite fair, but not true porcelain) and darker. I'm also getting to the age of larger pores, but the built in primer keeps this VERY smooth and it didn't settle in them at all. It's also really easy to blend - one night I went a little heavy and had no problem smoothing it to something more believable.

One thing I love about the compact - it's reusable. You can slide out the colors when you are done and refill it with other butter LONDON makeup. I'm happy about this because it's a super cute compact, even though it will be a long time before I use it up.

It does come with instructions, but if you are new to contouring, I'd suggest looking it up on Pinterest instead. In my experience, every face shape should contour differently.
summary: Another butter LONDON product to love - smooth, natural-looking and sensitive!

reviewText: This is a fun blue/green color... perhaps a little greener than this picture indicates.  I love the CND shellac. It stays on 8-14 days.

My wife has used this as a part of her morning and evening routine, and despite this being the first week of using the heat in our home, complete with all of the associated dry air, it's a welcome refreshing.  She uses this in addition to her usual serum, and the results, while not amazing, are quite nice.  In the short term the main benefits are the moisturizing, and we're not expecting much more immediately.

Sadly this all comes at a price, which can quickly add up.
summary: A great moisturizer, at a price

reviewText:
Easy to use and has a nice exfoliating action.

The scent is a bit strong, and while it is supposed to be a warm wood and orange scent, is more perfumey than I would like.

I enjoyed it, but my daughter hated the scent and refused to try it.
summary: Scent is a bit strong, but otherwise works well

reviewText: Love this color. Sheer stylish, love!

I absolutely love this liquid liner! The felt tip makes application so easy to apply. I couldn't believe how long it lasted too. I have oily lids and at the end of the day it still looked like I jjust applied it. I'm already planning on purchasing more. Love i!

I was quietly optimistic about these new serums. The directions were easy to follow:

Apply S-1 & S-2 twice daily, Apply S-3 only once (bedtime)
  Wash & dry face/ neck area
Apply approximately 5 drops of each, tapping/massaging the serum into the skin.
  Starting with *S-1 (Nourisher) features superfruit stemcells, moisturizes the skin, aids absorption
  Step two: apply *S-2 (Smoother) contains peptides targeting fine lines and wrinkles.
  Evening:  apply *S-3 (Lifter) contains Hyaluronic Acid and Vitamin C, to plump and brighten.

I put my regiment on hold and used these products as directed. Facial toning, smoothing, brightening and tightening are real concerns. We all want to rejuvenate our face...if not turn the clock back - slowing it down would be nice.

After using these serums for one month -
The Lifter. *S-3 was my favorite. My skin felt tighter and it was brighter. I had a subtle glow again. Using the three tiny bottles took some getting used too. This regiment took about 6 minutes longer than my usual. The serums were pleasant enough ...no foul odors or stickiness. The tiny dropper could be a problem for some. I would think NuFace could repackage these serums so that reading, grasping and dispensing are easier. Last, the price - I think it is high. Based on my use it averages out to $15 a week. Considering the results were no more effective than the product I have been using, I see no reason to change.

If you're considering a new product I definitely recommend this "starter set." It will give you ample time to evaluate your individual results, before investing in the larger, even more expensive bottles.

I'm 51 years old. My face does not give away my age but my neck does. I was considering going into debt for some type of laser or plastic surgery procedure when I ran across reviews for this product.
After using it for less than two weeks I can see a difference and am ordering more so I never run out.
Do yourself a favor and give it a try!

I wish I gave this spray a try long ago ,I have never used a dry shampoo ever and that's not the intention I had when purchasing this. I bought this because of all well mostly all great reviews how this gives volume. I found the reviews were correct ,first day using this I had alot of volume  and texture this did not weigh my hair down or leave any residue  or greasy feeling. I had to figure this out for myself a few times before I got this right. After my hair is washed,conditioned with Oribe shampoo I style my hair and just lightly use a few sprays and this really did hold my hair in place. I do touch up my hair during the day and sprayed a little more and I was very happy it wasn't crunchy or sticky .Just yesterday I place an order for the full size but still like the smaller can for traveling very convinent and greatful both sizes are made available.

I have never used a peel before, and really enjoyed this product. The smell is not great, but it's not terrible either -- a slight hint of apple, but not really fresh. Still, not a deal breaker. There is a bit of a slimy feel to it, it goes on smooth, and almost immediately begins to tingle, which worried me at first, but ultimately this didn't seem to be an indication that anything was wrong. By the time the recommended ten minutes had elapsed the peel had hardened a bit. It washed off like a masque. (Is a peel supposed to peel off?)

All that aside, afterward my skin felt great -- clean and smooth, very pleasant. Even the next day my skin feels great.

Packaging suggests you use this product twice a week. I've tried this twice with no adverse reaction. Au contraire! This is a really nice product.
summary: great, smooth skin is just ten minutes away!

reviewText: Elta makes such good products.  I adore their facial sunscreen.  This is great for me in summer.  For winter I need something a little more hydrating.
summary: Love Elta's products!  This is superb for my dehydrated in summer but not for winter.

reviewText: I used this color today to do my first ever at-home Shellac manicure.  I'm not a professional, but prefer doing my own nails, so I recently purchased the CND 6-bottle starter kit, a UV lamp, and an assortment of polish colors.  This color is so pretty!  I had to use 3 coats to get the coverage I wanted, but it turned out awesome.  It's a deep purplish-silver shimmer color.  I'm sure this will definately be one of my top 5 favorite colors.

Love the color! The polish goes on kind of clumpy for a brand new polish. That is the only negative and why I am not giving it a 5 star. I'm a little disappointed with that, because I absolutely love this color and thought Essie was the brand to get!!

After using for a week, I saw a significant reduction in my pore size, especially around my nose and cheek area. It is recommended that you use twice a day and you can even use it as a cleanser for make-up remover. The only drawback is that it tends to dry out my skin, so I have to use a moisturizer along side it. I trust Effaclar Clarifying Solution because they put out a good line of cleansing products for sensitive skin.

The first shade I bought I was very excited. It was "To Love", and I was extremely impressed with the opacity, staying power, smell, and texture. Then, I bought "Siena". I really like it too but noticed the color is very, very similar. Well, I just received Baby and it too is practically the exact same color! What's up with that?!

Now I see why they are $3!

I have become a fan of cleansing oil despite being skeptical the first time I tried it. It is great for when your skin is dry or more "mature" so you don't want to use a cleanser that is too harsh. I am also generally a fan of the L'Occitane products. This oil does a good job of cleansing and feels very nice. My only complaint is that it is a bit more scented (it has a flowery perfumey scent) than I would prefer. The good news is that the scent does not linger so much that I could smell it all night, but I would still prefer less scent. If not for the scent, I would give this 5 stars. If you want a good cleansing oil but want less scent, I like Juice Beauty Stem Cellular Cleansing Oil, 4 fl. oz..
summary: Great cleanser but a little too perfumey

reviewText: I have mixed feelings about this product. At first, it felt very strange to put oil on my face (especially since I had oily skin in my younger days), but it absorbs quickly and has a nice, exotic (almost spicy) scent. My skin does feel softer after using it for several days, and I did not have any problems with breakouts. However, this product is very expensive. On the plus side, there is quite a bit of the product, and you only need a tiny amount. I think you could probably get a year's daily use from the bottle, but I'm not sure how long the oil would last before it goes rancid. (I will update my review to let you know.) If you don't mind investing the money up front for a product that will last for a long time, this may be right for you. However, there are other products that will produce similar results that are available at a drugstore or discount store (Neutrogena, L'Oreal, etc.). This product is more of a luxury item and would make a nice gift.
summary: Not sure if it's worth the cost

reviewText: All you need is a "pearl" sized amount to cover your entire face in this primer.  It literally glides onto the skin, but I feel that my skin absorbs this base too quickly to effectively make a difference on the makeup that I put on top of it.  I assumed my makeup would "glide" onto my face after applying this, but it's not the case.  One thing I can say is that I feel like my face seems less oily at the end of the day when I use it.  After the couple times I've used it though, I've found myself not going out of my way to apply this before the rest of my make-up because I don't see enough of a difference between using it and using nothing.
This is a great peptide cream for everyday.  I love the way it makes my skin look and feel.

This iconic brand has been around for over 50 years. It was founded by a Romanian-born skin care specialist.

Moisture Magnet SPF 15 sun screen provides moderate sun protection in the form of a facial moisturizer. It is a light textured, pink lotion that comes in a no frills 2 ounce plastic squeeze bottle. The lotion has a light floral fragrance.

It smooths on easily and absorbs into the skin quickly. My face felt moisturized and soft many hours after application. I was able to apply foundation over the lotion and I had no problem with peeling or stickiness. The texture was dewy and comfortable.
summary: Moderate Sun Protection, Good Facial Moisturizer

reviewText: This is the best travel brush we have found yet.  The design is genius - it's a little tube with a screw-on ring for a lid. Unscrew the ring, take the brush inside out, then turn the brush& put through the ring and screw back together & you have a perfectly stable travel brush, no joints or parts to come loose and wiggle around while you are shaving.  The open design of the lid allows the brush to dry fairly well even when it is put away, although of course the open design means that it will leak a little water.  Just wrap it in a washcloth or put it in a baggie when it is in your suitcase and it will be fine.  The brush itself is of good quality - it is badger hair, hasn't lost any bristles yet, and is solid metal.  It could be a little heavier, but I guess lighter is better for travel.  My husband travels a lot and says this is the best travel brush he owns.

I bought this palette after watching a youtube makeup video (by Lustrelux) and it is by far my most used eyeshadow palette! I love trying new things but keep coming back to this because the pigmentation is the same on the skin as it is in the palette. Something about these matte shades allows for beautifully shadowed lids! I have the Naked 2 palatte and several small Lancome palettes but is my favorite. For a more dramatic look I might add a little shimmer to the brow bone or to top an all over color but during the day and for work this palette is enough. Thank you!

First of all, let me say that Proraso is good quality stuff.  I gave this 3 stars because IMHO, it doesn't work as well as the shave creams that come in the tubes.  I have a tube of Proraso, but wanted to try this, and the razor glides much better with the cream and I get a much better shave.  Also, from reading all the reviews and tips on how to use this soap, a lot of users are saying to swirl the brush directly in the container to start a lather, and then transfer to another bowl to complete the lather.  I did this and it does work well, but that makes it a 2-step process which I don't want to do.  I'd rather squeeze cream out of a tube directly on the brush, then do the lather in a shaving bowl.  And for those asking if this is a hard puck or a cream, it's kind of in-between.  It's not as hard as a traditional bar of soap, but it's definitely not a cream.  It's definitely solid enough that you can take the product out of the bowl and hold it in your hand, put it back in the bowl, and you wouldn't need to wipe any residue off your hand.
summary: The cream in the tubes has done much better for me.

reviewText: I like this gel very much and notice a subtle difference with the skin on my eyelids, it's a bit less crepey than usual. I  have a fair amount of sundamage from my younger years which is why the skin has lost it's tone. This gel has caused no sensitivity issues or problems at all, and my eyes get allergic to cosmetics at the drop of a hat so that's impressive. It's easy to apply and my makeup goes on smoothly. But it doesn't moisturize enough for me to not have to apply cream over it so I have knocked a star for that. I really prefer gel to cream formulations when it comes to eye products because I wear contacts and my eyes get 'testy' and irritable with eye cream. I am using the same eye cream as this line so it works well together as far as compatibility, my only gripe is that I'd love to use an eye gel that doesn't disappear once the product evaporates and this one isn't it. I need more moisture than it can provide but this might be better for younger, oilier skin types.

There's a well known spa close to me that I love for its mud baths. But it's pricey, and I only get a chance to go once every few years. I love what the mud does for my skin, making it soft and luxurious feeling. So the experience of even a simple mud mask is relaxing to me, and that's why I ordered this product--for the spa-like feel, and for the skin care.

I love that this mud comes in a pre-cut mask that  I can easily apply to my own face. I wasn't sure how that was going to work out in terms of surface coverage, but it really is awesome.

The mud comes preloaded on something akin to cheesecloth. It is precut for the upper and lower face. Applying it is really easy, and I was able to get full coverage over my entire face.

I could feel a slight tingle as soon as the mask touched my face. And that slight tingle continued the entire time I had the mask on. It wasn't painful or irritating. On the contrary, I drew myself a hot bath, put my head back and feet up, and let the mask do its work for a good 30 minutes (the directions indicate a minimum of 10 minutes, but it just felt so relaxing!

I'm not able to describe scent from the mud on the mask except to say that it reminds me of the spa--clean plus something else that I rather enjoy.

Removing the mask was simple. And, as it doesn't dry out completely, it was painless. It was also virtually mess free.

And best of all, I really can see improvement in minimizing my poors. My face also feels softer and smoother than before I applied the mask.

Unfortunately, the price point is beyond what I can typically afford (or at least what I'm willing to pay) on a regular basis. But I consider these a treat that id be willing to give myself from time to time.
summary: ... a well known spa close to me that I love for its mud baths

reviewText:
Great moisturizer, noticeable difference in softness of face after using it for just a few days, even works on winter roughened skin.
Pleasant light scent that made me think of citrus, rich luxurious feeling cream.

Rather pricy though, so you might want to shop around for something less expensive and try that first. But I was using this while my allergies were acting up and it even helped the sore skin around my nose from blowing my nose every 5 minutes.
summary: Even works on winter roughened skin, but a bit too expensive

reviewText: great soap

I don't know how I missed ever getting any of theBalm's luminizers, but it just never happened, and there was always another luminizer (like Hourglass's Ambient Lighting palette) that I coveted more. I had racked enough points at Birchbox and decided to take the plunge when they offered this trio.

I kept expecting disco ball, but I couldn't have been more wrong. Don't get me wrong, though: this is definitely more glittery than the Ambient Lighting palette, but the truth is that they are simply different. I've been warned off theBalm's lighting effects as simply being too too for a woman over 40. Some things you just gotta do for yourself, and unless you are as wrinkly as Miss Haversham, I see no reason why you couldn't enjoy these luminizers if you keep a light hand. They're simply lovely!

The effect is more intense than Hourglass, but with the aforesaid light hand and a fan brush, you can get a simply pretty look. They work great for fair-skinned girls like me, but I'd venture to say darker-complected ladies could make good use of these as well.

I essentially got them free for Birchbox points, but I like them so much, I'd have bought them anyway. If you're not a kidlette any longer but crave some sparkle, and you don't want to shell out for the Hourglass line, I can give these luminizers a hearty endorsement.
summary: Works for the over 40s who crave some sparkle (and don't want to shell out for Hourglass)

reviewText:
I buy this from "Majestic Beauty"  and the color look the same they show on the picture
really nice color and real Opi product too
Perfect color for the holidays!

The winter brings dry skin, and this product, Bioderma Atoderm Intensive Balm, is a very nice balm that stops any itching. My hands are quite dory, and this balm worked very well.

I do not have any particular dry skin issues except for aging and seasonal changes. I have used this balm on my feet after a nice soak, and the skin on my feet have become p,iable @n$ #oft. I can say the same for my hands. I would suspect that for anyone with a dermatitis, this balm would be lovely and quite helpful.

Recommended. prisrob 04-24-18
Great Product.. Great Shipping Thanks...

This 2-inch iron is ENORMOUS, as compared to other irons/wands. I was hoping it would work great for either huge curls, loose wave/curves, or for adding body to the very top of my head. It didn't work for any of those for me bc I think it's just too big to make anything really happen with the hair other than sort of straighten/iron it with a very slight curve. My hair is down to my waist too, so I did have plenty of length to try it on...but it just didn't work at all for me. Bummer, bc it looked so fun/cool to do different things!
Love love love this color!!!

If you really need  good moisturizer but don't like a rich cream in the summertime, this is the solution. If I don't use moisturizer, my skin feels painfully dry and tight, and I can easily end up with flaky skin.  I've tried other gel-texture moisturizers, but find myself reaching for a lotion within a few hours. This product goes on smoothly and feels cool and light -- using it is a nice experience, and my skin feels hydrated immediately.

More importantly for those of us with dry or aging skin, it leaves skin hydrated all day. It left my skin feeling a bit sticky for a couple of hours, so it is absorbed slowly and leaves a protective barrier. After a few days of use, I noticed that my skin seemed plumper and smoother.

The package is a nice heavy glass with a silvery mirrored top. The scent is light and pleasant. It contains Vichy water and no oil, just shea butter.
One of my favorite perfumes and the fact that it is unisex is awesome. I'm gifting this for my nephew.
summary: One of my favorite perfumes and the fact that it is unisex is ...

reviewText: This is a great firm hold hairspray.  I use it when I do an updo and I want no movement whatsoever.  The hold is very strong and it works no matter what the Florida weather dishes out, it even works when the humidity climbs.  This is my first can of Shaper and I bought it at Ulta duing a sale for $7.99.  I figured I had nothing to lose because the price was so low but I was pleasantly surprised that it worked so well.  Yes, it smells like a typical hairspray, but I'm not sensitive to it so it doesn't bother me.  But the fragrance dissipates quickly in any case.  This hairspray holds all day and into the next without leaving nasty white flakes, even if I use it several days in a row.  If you want a hairspray that won't allow your hair to move, then this is the right formula for you.
